"It's called Taste of Home," Julian explained eagerly. "A family-bonding show filmed on Coral Island in the South Sea."

He studied his sister's expression discreetly.

Since breaking off her engagement with Ethan Sullivan, Evelyn had been withdrawn. That bastard Ethan kept posting vague social media updates that made Julian's blood boil.

This show was the perfect opportunity.

A chance to cheer Evelyn up, let their family witness their dynamic through the live broadcast, and—most importantly—make Ethan back off for good.

"Ten days of filming, just in time to return for New Year's," Julian added. "It's 28°C on the island—we'll escape the winter in the capital."

A flicker of interest crossed Evelyn's eyes.

She'd never left the capital before. The prospect of a tropical island getaway was undeniably tempting.

"Are you... sure I can do this?" she whispered.

"Absolutely," Julian declared.

On departure day, the Langley mansion descended into chaos.

When Victoria Langley stuffed a fifth down jacket into the suitcase, Julian groaned. "Mom! It's the tropics!"

"What if there's a cold snap?" Victoria shot back, then turned to cram medications into Evelyn's bag. "Evie, speak up if you feel unwell. Don't tough it out."

Richard Langley stood by silently.

Nathaniel Langley approached holding a scalpel, its blade glinting coldly. "Julian."

Two syllables made Julian's spine stiffen.

"Don't worry, bro!" He raised his hand in oath. "I'll bring Evie back in one piece!"

Alexander Langley adjusted his gold-rimmed glasses, his gaze sharp behind the lenses. "Daily video check-ins."

"The crew's confiscating phones—"

"Figure it out," Alexander said with finality.

Watching her family's concern, warmth flooded Evelyn's chest. She hugged Victoria. "I'll take care of myself, Mom."

Julian seized the moment to drag their luggage toward the door. "Let's go! We'll miss our flight!"

The production team's van idled outside the gates. Evelyn took a deep breath and stepped forward—into her very first journey far from home.

###Chapter 294

The Lowell family discreetly escorted Julian Langley and Evelyn Laurent to the airport.

Everyone wore face masks and aviators to avoid unnecessary attention.

Evelyn stayed close to Julian, her fingers nervously twisting the hem of her blouse.

"Relax," Julian murmured reassuringly.

She took a deep breath and followed him into the VIP lane.

Thirty minutes later, their plane pierced through the clouds, heading toward Cloudhaven.

Meanwhile, Ethan Sullivan stood by the floor-to-ceiling windows, listening to his assistant's report.

"Miss Laurent has boarded?" A faint smirk played on his lips.

He'd been discreetly monitoring Evelyn's movements these past few days.

Unfortunately, her six brothers guarded her like a fortress.

"Harrison, you're in charge of the company," Ethan instructed as he turned.

Harrison Whitmore's eyes widened. "Where are you going, Mr. Sullivan?"

"A reality show." His tone was breezy.

Harrison nearly choked.

The CEO of Sullivan Group joining a reality show?

Then it clicked.

Only one person could make Ethan abandon work—Miss Laurent.

Four hours later, the plane touched down smoothly at Cloudhaven Airport.

Evelyn trailed behind Julian as they disembarked.

The production crew was already waiting.

"Mr. Langley, this is..." A staff member gaped at the mountain of luggage behind Julian.

Julian adjusted his aviators calmly. "Essentials."

The assistant director approached, torn between amusement and exasperation. "We're here to film, not vacation!"

Evelyn stifled a giggle behind Julian.

Her gaze swept the surroundings, sensing unseen eyes watching her.
###Chapter 295

Julian Langley dropped his luggage on the floor and collapsed into his seat.

"Mom insisted I bring Evelyn along," he grumbled. "Who dares disobey the matriarch?"

Timothy Gold, the assistant director, perked up immediately, his gaze locking onto Evelyn Laurent.

"Miss Laurent, I'm Timothy Gold."

Evelyn gave a slight nod. "Director Gold."

Julian interjected, "Tim and I have worked together before. He's one of us."

Timothy adjusted his glasses with a knowing smile. "This reality show focuses on sibling bonding, but..." He deliberately drew out his words. "Your brother is famously terrible at games."

"Hey!" Julian bristled. "Don't embarrass me in front of Evelyn!"

Timothy feigned innocence. "Just giving Miss Laurent fair warning."

Julian turned to his sister, eyes sparkling. "Evelyn's amazing at games. She'll carry me this time!"

Evelyn suppressed a smile.

Her brother's gaming skills... were indeed a tragedy.

"Wow," Timothy gasped dramatically, covering his mouth. "An Oscar-winning actor needs his little sister to carry him?"

Julian huffed and stared out the window.

So humiliating!

At least the live stream wasn't running yet.

Where would he hide his face otherwise?

Amused by their banter, Evelyn's eyes crinkled with silent laughter.

The car soon arrived at the hotel.

This season featured twelve celebrity-sibling pairs.

Evelyn and Julian were the first to arrive.

"Mr. Langley, you'll be in this suite," Timothy handed over the keycard. "The other guests will arrive over the next two days."

After settling in, Julian eagerly suggested, "Evelyn, want to explore?"

"Sure."

Before they left, Timothy reminded them sternly, "Keep those masks on!"

The production team had already hyped the show on social media.

Though the cast remained unannounced, the tropical island teaser had sparked massive buzz.

Viewers everywhere were eagerly waiting.

###Chapter 296

Julian Langley spent the entire day showing Evelyn Laurent around Cloudhaven.

From the misty dawn to the glittering evening lights, they sampled every local delicacy. They only returned to the hotel when night had fully fallen.

Evelyn froze the moment they stepped into the lobby.

Two familiar figures stood at the center.

Beatrice Quincy looked ready for a red carpet event in her designer suit and flawless makeup, chatting animatedly with Timothy Gold.

Beside her, Bianca Fairchild was a stark contrast.

Head bowed and dragging her luggage, Bianca seemed shrouded in shadows next to her radiant sister.

"Director Gold, has Julian Langley arrived yet?"

Beatrice's sickly sweet voice cut through the air.

Timothy offered a professional smile. "My apologies, Miss Quincy. Guest information is confidential."

Even a child could hear the dismissal in his tone.

A flicker of irritation crossed Beatrice's eyes before she forced another saccharine smile. "How thoughtless of me."

Just then, Timothy spotted Julian and Evelyn entering.

He gave an imperceptible blink.

Julian immediately tugged his cap lower and steered Evelyn toward a different elevator.

"Third Brother, are they also guests?" Evelyn whispered inside the elevator.

Julian nodded. "The Quincy sisters. Night and day."

Coldness flashed in his eyes.

During the last recording, he'd secretly helped Bianca multiple times. Otherwise, her situation would've been far worse.

Beatrice had never treated Bianca like a sister.

Back in their room, Evelyn curled up on the sofa with her tablet. "I want to watch the last episode."

She quickly finished the edited version of Sibling Revelry.

Her expression darkened.

Just as she'd suspected, Beatrice had crafted a perfect persona while painting Bianca as both foolish and malicious.

Bianca's passive acceptance made Evelyn's chest tighten.

Ding-dong—

The sudden doorbell interrupted her thoughts.

The moment Julian opened the door, Beatrice's delighted voice rang out. "Julian Langley! It really is you!"
###Chapter 297

Julian Langley was packing his luggage when the knock came.

He frowned and opened the door, his expression instantly turning icy at the sight of Beatrice Quincy's flawlessly made-up face.

"What do you want?" He braced one arm against the doorframe, making no move to let her in.

Beatrice flipped her hair with a practiced smile. "I heard the Oscar-winning actor Julian Langley was joining this season's show. Thought I'd drop by to say hello."

She rose on her tiptoes, peering over his shoulder into the room. "I wonder who your partner will be this time—"

"None of your business." Julian cut her off, his voice frigid. "If that's all, I need to rest."

He moved to shut the door.

Beatrice hastily pressed a hand against it. "Wait! I—"

Bang!

The door slammed in her face, the gust of wind tousling her bangs.

Trembling with rage, she dug her nails into her palms.

An Oscar-winning actress like her—when had she ever been treated with such disdain?

Inside the suite, Evelyn Langley was curled on the sofa watching past episodes.

"Third Brother, you're too harsh on women." She didn't look up. "Beatrice looked like she was about to cry."

Julian scoffed. "She was acting."

He sat beside his sister just as the screen showed him and Theodore Langley bumbling through a game challenge.

"Why are you watching this?" He reached for the remote.

Evelyn dodged with a grin. "It's hilarious."

A flood of LOLs scrolled across the screen:

[Is this really an Oscar winner's gaming skills?]
[Theodore looks ready to strangle his brother]
[Guess they traded brains for looks and talent]

What annoyed Julian most was how Beatrice always swooped in to "rescue" him during these moments.

Shippers spammed the comments:
[Beatrice is so protective of Julian]
[This ship is canon]

"Third Brother," Evelyn leaned in suddenly, "you're not actually into Beatrice, are you?"

"Never!" Julian nearly leapt off the sofa. "That two-faced woman makes my skin crawl!"

Evelyn collapsed into giggles.

At dawn the next day, production vans arrived at the hotel.

A new season of filming was about to begin.
###Chapter 298

The sea breeze gently brushed across the deck of the luxury yacht.

Bianca Fairchild and Beatrice Quincy stood side by side, their profiles dazzling under the sunlight.

Julian Langley leaned lazily against the railing while Evelyn Laurent stood beside him, curiously observing the other guests.

"Is that Crystal Rothschild?" Evelyn whispered.

Julian followed her gaze. The rising starlet Hugo Rothschild was tenderly fixing his sister's wind-tousled hair.

"And the Clemenson siblings," Julian pointed toward Rachel and Leo Clemenson, who were taking photos nearby.

The newly arrived Liam and Lucas Croix chatted with the crew. Both wore sportswear, radiating youthful energy.

"The director mentioned two mystery guests," Evelyn said, eyes sparkling. "Who could they be?"

Timothy Gold approached with a megaphone. "Everyone, please gather in the conference room."

Inside, Eugene York adjusted the equipment.

"These mystery guests are special," he said with a mysterious wink. "You'll find out when we reach the island."

Julian suddenly frowned. "This yacht..."

He felt an odd familiarity with the vessel but couldn't place it.

"What's wrong?" Timothy asked sharply.

"Nothing." Julian waved it off. "Since when did the production team become so extravagant?"

Timothy cleared his throat. "A guest sponsored it."

His evasive tone hinted at hidden truths.

As the yacht departed, the live broadcast began.

Eugene collected everyone's phones. "This season's theme is—Survival Challenge!"

Evelyn clenched her fists in excitement while the others exchanged uneasy glances.

"Don't worry, we've scouted the location," Eugene reassured. "The island is safe with abundant resources."

Crystal bit her lip. "Are we really staying there?"

"Of course," Eugene said. "But basic supplies will be provided."

Leo suddenly raised his hand. "Director, will the mystery guests join us?"

Eugene smirked. "They're already on the island."

The yacht cut through the waves toward the unknown destination. No one noticed Julian's increasingly grave expression as he stared at the horizon.

Something told him this wouldn't be a simple filming.
###Chapter 299

The live stream had barely begun when Danmu flooded the screen.

"Finally! This lineup is incredible!"

"Oh my god! Is that a luxury yacht? The production team went all out!"

"I heard they're filming on a private island. The trailer looked unreal!"

Eugene York smiled at the camera, microphone in hand. "Welcome, everyone. Let's start with brief introductions from our guests."

Beatrice Quincy stepped forward first, flipping her hair gracefully. "Hello, I'm Beatrice Quincy."

Bianca Fairchild followed, her voice barely audible. "I-I'm Bianca Fairchild..."

The other guests introduced themselves one by one. Finally, it was Julian Langley's turn—and the girl standing beside him.

Julian offered a warm smile. "I'm Julian Langley."

The moment the camera panned to the young woman next to him, Danmu exploded.

"Evelyn Laurent," she said coolly, her expression unreadable.

"Wait—Julian's partner changed?"

"Who is she? She looks just like him!"

"Is she the rumored seventh Langley sister?"

"No way a Langley heiress would join a reality show."

"Total plastic surgery vibes. Just riding Julian's fame."

"The official account mentioned a special guest. Probably a civilian role."

Evelyn remained oblivious to the chatter, standing quietly at Julian's side with perfect poise.

The other guests, however, couldn't stop staring. Sunlight gilded her delicate features, making even Beatrice glance twice.

Beatrice clenched her fist. She'd heard about the scandal at Harvard. This Evelyn had publicly humiliated her adoptive parents—cold and calculating.

"Attention, everyone," Eugene interrupted. "We'll reach our destination in three hours. Feel free to rest until then."

The live feed cut off abruptly, but speculation about the mysterious girl had only just begun.

No one noticed Evelyn's face growing paler by the minute.
###Chapter 300

Evelyn curled up on the cruise cabin sofa, her body limp as if drained of all strength.

The ship swayed with the ocean waves, making her dizzy and nauseous.

Her knuckles turned white as she gripped the armrest.

A sheen of cold sweat coated her forehead, her lips pale.

"Evelyn!"

Julian burst into the room, his heart clenching at the sight of his sister.

He rushed forward, nearly stumbling from the ship's violent rocking.

"Julian..." Her voice was barely audible, trembling with tears. "I think... I'm seasick."

Julian fumbled in his pocket and pulled out a packet of Dramamine. "Take this!"

Though he also felt queasy, his symptoms were milder since he'd taken the pills earlier.

Evelyn swallowed the medicine but still shivered with discomfort.

This was her first time on a ship.

She never imagined it would be this unbearable.

Three hours later, the cruise finally slowed as it approached the island.

Through the porthole, Evelyn glimpsed lush greenery, and her dull eyes instantly brightened.

"We're here!"

Her weak cheer came out hoarse.

Julian exhaled in relief.

On deck, Timothy Gold raised a megaphone. "Welcome to the filming location of Island Adventure!"

The live stream resumed.

The Fairchild sisters disembarked first. Bianca was ghostly pale, doubling over to vomit the moment she stepped onto the dock.

Beatrice patted her back anxiously.

The other guests followed suit.

The Langley siblings staggered off last, only relaxing when their feet touched solid ground.

Evelyn discreetly stretched her shaky legs.

Finally free.
###Chapter 301

Comments fluttered across the live stream like snowflakes.

"Finally, season two! Beatrice looks stunning today!"

"How dare Bianca show her face after hurting Beatrice last time?"

"Who's that new civilian girl clinging to Julian?"

Evelyn Laurent sensed hostile gazes as cameras panned over the guests. She instinctively moved closer to Julian Langley.

"Relax," Julian murmured, maintaining his Oscar-winning actor aloofness.

Beatrice Quincy approached with a saccharine smile. "Need help, Julian?"

"No." His curt reply made her smile falter.

A flicker of malice crossed Beatrice's eyes when she glanced at Evelyn.

"Ugh—"

Bianca's sudden retching broke the tension. She crouched on the sand, face ashen.

Evelyn frowned and pulled a water bottle from her bag.

"Here."

Bianca looked up, startled. "Thanks..." Her weak gratitude held complex emotions.

The cameras captured it perfectly.

"That civilian's surprisingly kind."

"Total act for screen time."

Timothy Gold clapped for attention. "Welcome to 'Sibling Revelry' season two! We'll spend ten days surviving on this private island!"

He winked. "You've noticed our two mystery guests."

Cameras shifted to Liam and Lucas Croix, who fidgeted under the celebrities' gaze. Rachel and Leo Clemenson appeared more confident from last season's popularity.

Crystal Rothschild clung to her brother Hugo's arm. "Hi everyone!"

Hugo merely nodded, his icy prince persona intact.

"First challenge—build your camp!" Timothy announced. "Two hours. Teams of two."

Evelyn moved toward her brother, but Beatrice intercepted.

"Partner with me, Julian?"

"I already have one." Julian strode to Evelyn, leaving Beatrice digging nails into her palms.

Danmu exploded.

"What's happening?"

"Who IS that civilian?"

Island winds whipped Evelyn's hair. She glanced toward the dense jungle, sensing unseen eyes watching...
###Chapter 302

His icy demeanor had also attracted many fans.

Timothy Gold winked mysteriously and raised his megaphone. "Ladies and gentlemen, the most exciting moment has arrived!"

He deliberately drew out his words, his gaze sweeping over each guest.

Julian Langley leaned lazily against a tree trunk, his fingers unconsciously rubbing his cuff.

"But before revealing the final two mystery guests—" Timothy suddenly raised his voice. "We're going to play a little game!"

Julian's brow furrowed slightly.

The word "game" gave him an instant headache.

"See that little cabin with the red roof?" Timothy pointed into the distance. "Our new guests are waiting for you there."

"The first guest to arrive will receive a million-dollar island development resource package!"

Drones buzzed overhead, capturing every subtle change in expression.

Evelyn Laurent's eyes sparkled like stars.

She flexed her wrists, her gaze burning toward the finish line.

"Each team will send one representative!" Timothy announced.

"I'll do it!" Evelyn dashed forward in a flash.

Beatrice Quincy followed closely. "Bianca isn't feeling well. I'll take her place."

Rachel Clemenson gave Julian a meaningful look. "Not joining us, Oscar winner?"

Julian waved a dismissive hand. "I have terrible luck."

His peripheral vision caught Evelyn's eager stance, and the corner of his mouth lifted.

The danmu exploded:

[Is this girl crazy? What's a twig like her trying to prove?]

[Clearly Julian wants nothing to do with her!]

[Are you blind? He literally admitted he's a game jinx!]

[I think the way he looks at her is kinda tender?]

Rachel narrowed her eyes.

If Evelyn really were a Lowell heiress, why would Julian let her participate in such a physical challenge?

She smirked inwardly, waiting for the show.
###Chapter 303

The drone camera captured Evelyn Laurent stretching her wrists at the starting line. Her high ponytail swayed as the black tracksuit accentuated her snow-pale complexion.

"On your marks—"

Timothy Gold's voice barely faded before Evelyn launched forward like a cheetah.

Approaching the first hurdle, she tapped the ground lightly with her toes. Her body soared through the air in a flawless arc, landing without even stirring dust.

The obstacle pit loomed ahead. She vaulted in, palms bracing against the walls. With a powerful core twist, she flipped over the edge effortlessly—as though she'd practiced the move a thousand times.

Danmu exploded across screens:

[Holy shit that was insane!]

[Queen Evelyn slays! Those core muscles!]

At the one-meter wall, Evelyn suddenly accelerated. Her right foot kicked off the surface while her left hand gripped the ledge. A graceful front flip carried her over.

Hugo Rothschild's pupils constricted. He'd just cleared the third hurdle when the black-clad figure was already sprinting toward the balance beam.

Thud.

Evelyn knocked on the cabin door just as Beatrice Quincy crawled out of the pit, disheveled. Dirt streaked her ruined updo and tracksuit.

Live stream comments scrolled wildly:

[The skill gap is ridiculous]

[Evelyn is legendary!]

[Where are the haters now?]

A crew member stammered, "Y-yes, the mystery guest is inside..."

Evelyn shook her ponytail, breathing as steady as if she'd taken a leisurely stroll. She glanced back at the course—Hugo was scaling the final obstacle wall, sweat glistening at his temples.

The drone caught the feral curve of her lips. That satisfied smirk of a well-fed predator.

"Seems I won decisively."
###Chapter 304

Hugo Rothschild vaulted over the obstacle wall with feline grace, landing squarely before the cargo net.

The other contestants lagged far behind, their movements clumsy in comparison.

Julian Langley watched with a faint smile, his gaze tracking the agile figure.

His sister Evelyn was performing exceptionally well.

"Little brother?" Evelyn prompted again.

The staff member snapped out of his daze. "Right! This is the spot."

As she reached for the door, he hastily added, "But we can't open it until all contestants finish."

Evelyn withdrew her hand, standing composed at the finish line.

The survival kit was as good as hers.

Crystal Rothschild and others gaped at the timer, stunned by Evelyn's staggering lead.

Hugo arrived second, a full minute behind Evelyn.

Leo Clemenson panted as he stumbled across the line. "Miss Laurent, your speed is insane!"

Evelyn merely glanced at him without responding.

Liam Croix followed, dusting himself off awkwardly. "Evelyn, I take back what I said earlier."

His face burned with humiliation.

The group assembled at the finish—except for Beatrice Quincy.

The cameras panned to the pit obstacle where Beatrice struggled pathetically.

After multiple failed attempts to climb out, tears welled in her eyes.

The live chat exploded:

[Help Beatrice already!]

[That useless Bianca!]

[Faking seasickness? Disgusting!]

Bianca Fairchild fought through her nausea, staggering toward the pit.

"Sis, let me pull you up."

Beatrice grasped her hand gratefully. "Thank you, Annie."

In that instant, cold calculation flashed in Beatrice's eyes.

She yanked hard.

"Ah!"

Bianca toppled into the pit, her skull striking a rock. Blood gushed instantly.

"Annie!" Beatrice shrieked in feigned alarm.
###Chapter 305

Bianca Fairchild's vision went black.

The violent impact nearly knocked her unconscious.

Her already weakened body took another devastating blow.

Beatrice Quincy's sudden yank caught her completely off guard.

"Bianca, are you okay?"

Beatrice clutched her with panic-stricken hands, voice trembling. "This is all my fault. I shouldn't have pulled you when you're not feeling well."

Blood streamed down Bianca's forehead.

Pain sealed her lips shut. She could only bite down hard.

Her face turned ghostly pale.

"Bianca, say something!"

Beatrice stamped her foot in distress.

Timothy Gold and the crew rushed over. Staff members scrambled to pull them ashore.

Evelyn Laurent approached with stormy eyes.

She'd seen Beatrice's deliberate tug clearly.

But the angle made it nearly impossible for cameras to catch.

Medics arrived swiftly.

The gash on Bianca's forehead was horrifying. Blood painted half her face crimson.

Beatrice stumbled backward at the sight.

[She's totally faking it! Look how scared Beatrice is!]

[This has to be staged. She's trying to frame our Beatrice!]

[How dare this imposter act so bold?]

[After everything the Quincy family's done for her, this is how she repays them?]

The live chat exploded.

Victoria Langley watched the stream with furrowed brows. She turned to Richard Langley. "What's wrong with the Quincys? Beatrice is clearly targeting Bianca. The online abuse is vile. Aren't they going to intervene?"

She'd done her research.

Bianca had been cyberbullied relentlessly since episode one.

Richard's gaze darkened. "Bianca isn't their biological daughter. Just a stepping stone they cultivated for Beatrice."

Victoria clenched her fists. "That girl has gone too far."

"Bianca's such a sweet child."

Gentle. Well-mannered.

Yet always bullied.

She remembered Bianca vividly.

But family matters weren't hers to meddle in.

With a sigh, Victoria refocused on her daughter.

Pride instantly lit her face. "Look at our Evelyn! She's lightning fast!"

Evelyn moved like a blur.

The drone barely kept pace with her sprint.

Her athletic form made Victoria's pulse race.

Richard chuckled, pulling his wife close. "Our girl's always been the best."

"Damn right!"

Victoria nestled against him, eyes glued to the screen.

Meanwhile, on the island...
###Chapter 306

Bianca Fairchild's forehead was now wrapped in pristine white gauze.

Beatrice Quincy's eyes reddened, her voice trembling. "It's all my fault for reacting too slowly..."

She carefully grasped Bianca's hand, her fingertips shaking. "Does it hurt?"

Bianca gave a faint shake of her head, her lips pale. "It's nothing."

She forced a weak smile. "Don't let me delay the filming."

Timothy Gold visibly relaxed after confirming she was okay. "Glad you're alright."

Evelyn Laurent shot Beatrice a cold glance but remained silent.

The minor disturbance quickly settled.

All eyes returned to the mysterious wooden cabin.

Timothy announced with a smile, "The obstacle course winner is Evelyn Laurent! She'll unveil our mystery guests!"

Evelyn was genuinely curious about the identities of these guests.

The production team had kept it airtight—not even she could guess who they were.

With anticipation, she pushed open the wooden door.

The interior was modest, sparsely furnished.

A chessboard sat in the center, where two men were engaged in a game.

The man in black facing away from the door exuded calm, while his opponent in a gray suit kept glancing outside.

The moment the door opened, the gray-suited man jerked his head up.

Evelyn's pupils constricted.

Beatrice's shriek echoed simultaneously. "Big brother?!"

Bianca looked up, her face paling further at the sight of Xander Quincy.

Why was he here...

The live chat exploded:

[Beatrice called him big brother?]

[The Quincy heir actually showed up!]

[Look at that worried expression—definitely here to back Beatrice!]

[The Quincys really dote on her!]

Xander's gaze slid past Beatrice before settling on Bianca's bandaged forehead.

His Adam's apple bobbed, words caught in his throat.

In the end, he just turned away irritably.

Evelyn's attention was wholly captured by the man in black.

That silhouette felt inexplicably familiar.

As if sensing her stare, he slowly rose and turned.

A breathtakingly handsome face came into view.

Those deep eyes locked onto Evelyn.

Julian Langley instantly bristled. "Ethan Sullivan?!"

He yanked at his hair in frustration. "You're the mystery sponsor?"

No matter how hard they tried, they couldn't keep this guy from chasing after her!
###Chapter 307

Ethan Sullivan's lips curved slightly, his eyes shimmering with warmth.

"Third brother."

His gaze lingered briefly on Julian Langley before shifting to Evelyn Laurent, his smile deepening.

Those profound eyes reflected only one person's image.

On the cruise ship deck, the sea breeze tousled his hair.

[Ethan Sullivan, CEO of Sullivan Group!]

[He never participates in reality shows!]

[Even the International Physics Society's invitation was declined]

[What's so special about this show?]

The live chat exploded instantly.

Viewership numbers skyrocketed visibly.

The six Langley brothers stared at the screen, their expressions darkening one by one.

Julian scoffed, his sharp gaze like daggers.

The other guests stood frozen in shock.

Crystal Rothschild discreetly smoothed her dress while Rachel Clemenson nervously twisted the hem of her shirt.

"Welcome our two new members."

Timothy Gold broke the tension smoothly.

Facing the cameras, Ethan's aura turned icy.

"Ethan Sullivan."

Three simple words chilled the air.

Xander Quincy followed suit. "Xander Quincy."

Scattered applause echoed through the space.

Julian crossed his arms. Evelyn frowned slightly.

"Congratulations, Evelyn Laurent, for winning the Survival Kit."

A staff member handed her a camouflage backpack.

Evelyn eagerly unzipped it.

Flashlight. Lighter. Hardtack...

"That's it?"

She pouted, twirling the Swiss Army Knife between her fingers.

Timothy smirked mysteriously. "These are life-saving essentials."

"Time to form teams—four members each."

He shook a lottery box.

Evelyn stepped forward first.
###Chapter 308

Ethan Sullivan stepped forward, intending to approach Evelyn Laurent.

Julian Langley reacted instantly, pulling Evelyn protectively behind him.

"I'll go," he said coldly, his tall frame completely blocking Ethan's line of sight.

Ethan remained unfazed, casually drawing a lot.

The grouping results were soon announced.

Julian Langley, Evelyn Laurent, Ethan Sullivan, and Xander Quincy formed the first team.

Bianca Fairchild and her brother were paired with the Croix brothers in the second team.

The Clemenson siblings and the Rothschild siblings made up the third team.

Julian's expression darkened instantly.

His gaze locked onto Ethan, radiating danger.

Timothy Gold discreetly tugged at his sleeve. "Mr. Langley, mind your expression."

The usually composed Oscar-winning actor now resembled a bristling lion.

Ethan remained unperturbed, though a flicker of warmth crossed his eyes when he glanced at Evelyn.

His purpose here had always been singular.

"Brother, looks like we're opponents now," Beatrice Quincy teased Xander with a playful wink. "Go easy on me."

Xander nodded indulgently. "Of course."

But his gaze darkened when it briefly passed over Bianca.

"Tonight is the last dinner and lodging provided by the production crew," Timothy announced through the megaphone. "Starting tomorrow, you'll be surviving on this island independently."

The staff served an elaborate feast.

Ethan had arranged the menu in advance, with most dishes tailored to Evelyn's preferences.

Evelyn scanned the spread before taking her seat, deep in thought.

Julian immediately claimed the seat to her left.

Ethan calmly settled into the chair on her right.

The other guests gradually joined the table.

With the survival challenge looming tomorrow, everyone ate with unusual focus.

The Croix brothers and the Clemenson siblings devoured their meals heartily.

Such refined cuisine would be hard to come by in the days ahead.

The cast members regarded Ethan with newfound reverence.

This sponsor was someone to keep on their good side.
###Chapter 309

The live stream cut off abruptly, sending Twitter into a frenzy.

Two hashtags battled for the top spot: #CancelBiancaFairchild and #EthanSullivanJoinsShow.

The reality show Siblings skyrocketed in popularity. Despite multiple interruptions, viewers remained rabidly engaged.

The dynamic duo Eugene York and Timothy Gold had undeniable star power. Every show they produced struck a chord with audiences, amassing legions of loyal fans.

The real surprise was landing Julian Langley, one of Hollywood's biggest stars. Ethan Sullivan's unexpected appearance sent ratings through the roof.

The barrage of excited comments nearly overwhelmed the screen.

The private island, rented at astronomical cost, became the audience's biggest obsession.

Lush jungles and turquoise shores glowed on camera, a rare winter paradise while most of the country lay buried in snow.

Dinner ended in uneasy silence.

Ethan sat at the head of the table, his presence making everyone tread lightly. Even breathing seemed too loud.

Timothy patted his round stomach. "Tonight you'll sleep on the yacht again. This cabin will serve as our supply depot." He winked. "Starting tomorrow, all survival gear must be earned through challenges."

Crew members distributed black wristbands.

"These are specialized GPS trackers," Timothy emphasized. "Most of this island is uncharted wilderness. Keep them on at all times."

Evelyn Laurent toyed with her band, the metal glinting coldly under the lights. She snapped it on and turned toward the window.

Moonlight cascaded over the island like liquid silver.

Salty ocean air carried the scent of tropical foliage.

Without hesitation, Evelyn pushed back her chair.

Julian followed instantly, shooting Ethan a guarded look.

The Oscar-winning actor dabbed his lips with a napkin and rose leisurely.

Rachel Clemenson tugged her brother's sleeve. "Let's get some air?"

Crystal Rothschild linked arms with her brother, beaming. "The moon's too beautiful to miss."

The Croix brothers trailed wordlessly behind.

The cabin door creaked as ten figures melted into the night.

Pearlescent sand shimmered under the moon. Waves crashed against the shore in the stillness.

Each wore the black wristband—puppets strung by invisible threads.

Deep in the jungle, unknown creatures shrieked.

The darkness yawned like a beast's maw, patiently awaiting its prey.
###Chapter 310

The suited man's taunting made Zhang Yuan frown.

What status did this guy think he had?

And who did he think the old man was?

Memories from his past life flooded back in an instant.

Li Aiping!

The wealthiest man in Qingcheng!

This elderly gentleman had only found his long-lost son on his deathbed.

He wandered these old streets alone because it was where he'd lost his beloved child.

His wife had died young from heartbreak.

His younger second wife bore him a daughter.

The icy beauty standing before them—Li Ruobing.

As for this suited man...

Zhang Yuan found no trace of him in his memories.

Neither biological nor adopted son.

Most likely one of Li Ruobing's suitors.

Realizing this, Zhang Yuan smirked.

"Whoever you are...bring it on."

"My acupuncture needles will settle this."

The suited man trembled with rage.

Just as he prepared to retaliate, Li Ruobing's tearful voice interrupted.

"Chen Tao! What's the point of this now?"

"Call an ambulance!"

The man shot Zhang Yuan a venomous glare.

His gaze lingered briefly on Lin Weiwei.

Reluctantly, he pulled out his phone.

"Fine...don't worry Ruobing...I'll contact the hospital."

He secretly snapped photos of Zhang Yuan and Lin Weiwei.

Before he could dial, ambulance sirens approached.

Probably called by bystanders.

Seeing the paramedics arrive, Zhang Yuan tugged Lin Weiwei away.

She stomped her foot in frustration.

"Yuan! This family's insane!"

"You tried helping and they attacked you."

"No wonder people hesitate to assist elders these days..."

Zhang Yuan simply smiled.

He saw greater opportunities ahead.

'When the old man wakes, he'll come thanking me.'

'Then...I'll help him find his lost son...'

'That favor will be worth his while.'

"Yuan? Why so quiet?"

"Disappointed? That woman actually hit me!"

"Money doesn't excuse that behavior!"

"If you hadn't stopped me, I'd have—"

Zhang Yuan waved her off.

"Let it go. Misunderstandings get cleared eventually."

"By the way, how'd you get here?"

Lin Weiwei shook her phone.

"Rideshare...Yuan, I'm starving."

"Barbecue on me?"

Zhang Yuan's stomach growled before he could refuse.

Twenty meters ahead, "Nautilus Grill's" neon sign glowed.

"Fine. My treat."

Lin Weiwei's eyes sparkled.

"I'm ordering everything!"

......

Inside the barbecue joint.

Lin Weiwei eagerly scanned the menu.

"Yuan, pork belly okay?"

"How about ribeye? Spicy clams?"

Zhang Yuan sighed. "Your call."

"The black pepper sausages look good..."

"New place. Never tried."

Lin Weiwei poured tea and offered fruit.

"Yuan, about boosting yang energy—"

His phone rang—Su Rourou calling.

Lin Weiwei pouted.

"Wife checking in?"

"Heard she's vacationing in Europe with friends..."

Zhang Yuan's expression shifted.

This call...meant trouble.

"Hello?"

A saccharine voice answered.

"Honey~ Miss me?"

"Busy at the clinic?"

Zhang Yuan suppressed his disgust.

"Swamped. With patients."

"Need something?"
###Chapter 311

The sudden surge of spiritual pressure in the air froze Ling Jiuzé in place.

This level of oppressive force was unmatched in all of Emberfall City.

Only a legendary Golden Core cultivator could wield such power...

Impossible!

How could a young man reach such heights?

Yet the churning of his blood didn't lie—he was truly immobilized under this crushing weight.

Ling Jiuzé gritted his teeth, forcing his spiritual energy to resist. His eyes burned with disbelief as he glared at Thunderblade.

The air between them seemed to solidify.

Ling Jiuan sensed the tension but couldn't grasp its source.

Beads of sweat formed on Ling Jiuzé's forehead, his face growing paler by the second.

Thunderblade remained unfazed, not even a ripple disturbing his robes.

Just as Ling Jiuan opened her mouth to speak, a delicate fragrance drifted through the air.

The servants snapped out of their daze, bowing in unison. "Madame Lan."

Ling Jiuan turned to see an elegant noblewoman gliding toward them.

"My dear fifth daughter has finally returned." The woman's smile was warm as she descended the steps.

Thunderblade's gaze flickered, the oppressive aura vanishing instantly.

Ling Jiuzé exhaled sharply, his flexible sword clattering to the ground.

Madame Lan's eyes gleamed as she clasped Ling Jiuan's hands. "How I've missed you all these years, my dear."

Ling Jiuan subtly withdrew her hands. "Your concern is appreciated, Aunt Lan."

"Mother, look at her arrogance!" Ling Jiuzé snatched up his sword, scowling. "Winning one match by luck doesn't make her special!"

"Silence!" Madame Lan chided lightly. "Your sister triumphed in the arena despite lacking spiritual roots. Such perseverance deserves praise."

Ling Jiuan smirked inwardly.

Her stepmother's acting far surpassed her children's.

With a final glare, Ling Jiuzé stormed off.

Madame Lan turned to Thunderblade with feigned surprise. "And this gentleman is—"

"My master, Thunderblade." Ling Jiuan cut her off, tugging him away without ceremony.

Behind them, Old Nanny Liu's whining voice rose. "Madame, the fifth young lady—"

"Hold your tongue! Masters disciplining servants is only natural!" Madame Lan snapped.

Ling Jiuan didn't pause or glance back.

"Your stepmother seems protective," Thunderblade remarked.

"False kindness," Ling Jiuan scoffed. "If she truly cared, would she let servants withhold my allowances?"

A glint of approval flashed in Thunderblade's eyes. "Not as foolish as you appear."

"What's that supposed to mean?" She glared. "That was a temporary act. Don't actually think you're my master now."

"Commit to the role once taken." He strode ahead into the courtyard. "Remember to address me properly before others."

Ling Jiuan froze.

The icy Thunderblade from their first meeting was now joking with her?

Her eyes lifted to the gate's plaque. "'Jiuan Pavilion'? How unimaginative."

In Cloudwater Manor, Ling Jiuzé seethed. "Why tolerate her insolence, Mother? That wretch has no respect!"

Madame Lan stroked the spirit rabbit in her lap. "She just brought honor to our family. Acting now would be unwise."

"Father's only putting on a show!" Ling Jiuzé spat. "Once the mystic realm expedition ends—"

"You couldn't even handle the man beside her." With a flick of her wrist, the rabbit yelped as it hit a pillar. "Anyone who trained a body-refining ninth-stage Ling Jiuan is no simple figure."

Ling Jiuzé's expression darkened. "You're suggesting..."

"Fetch your sister." Madame Lan's eyes narrowed. "This requires... careful planning."
###Chapter 312

"Ahhh—"

A piercing scream tore through the night.

Julian Langley jolted backward as if electrocuted, stumbling three meters away.

His back slammed against a tree trunk.

"Snake! There's a snake!"

His voice cracked with terror.

A pitch-black serpent coiled on the branch, its crimson tongue flicking in the air.

Its cold, vertical pupils locked onto him.

Julian's blood turned to ice.

He had always been terrified of slithering creatures.

The snake was barely ten centimeters from his nose.

He could even smell its musky, reptilian scent.

"Hiss—"

The serpent suddenly arched its body.

Julian's pupils constricted in panic.

At that critical moment—

A figure darted forward like lightning.

Evelyn Laurent's slender fingers clamped precisely behind the snake's head.

Thwack!

The serpent's tail lashed against her wrist, leaving a red welt.

She didn't even flinch.

With a swift motion, she hurled the snake through the air.

Whoosh—

It landed over a dozen meters away, smacking against a boulder.

The entire ordeal lasted less than three seconds.

By the time Ethan Sullivan rushed over, he only saw Evelyn shaking out her hand.

"Are you hurt?"

He grabbed her wrist, his thumb brushing the red mark.

Evelyn pulled away. "Just a scratch."

She turned to Julian, who was still trembling.

"Third Brother?"

She waved a hand in front of his dazed eyes.

Julian snapped back to reality.

"I'm fine!"

His voice was an octave higher than usual.

He straightened his posture with forced bravado, though his gaze kept darting toward where the snake had been flung.

Ethan suppressed a smirk. "Third Brother is quite brave."

"Of course!"

Julian lifted his chin defiantly.

"I just... found it disgusting."

Even as he spoke, he inched closer to Evelyn.

She bit back a smile.

Her third brother—

terrified out of his wits but still putting on a tough act.

"Let's go."

She looped her arm through Julian's, feeling the faint tremors in his muscles.

When she glanced back, she met Ethan's warm gaze.

Under the moonlight—

his eyes overflowed with tenderness.
###Chapter 313

Ethan Sullivan's smile deepened as Evelyn Laurent turned to look at him. He gave her a slight nod.

Her heart softened.

She saw unmistakable tenderness in his eyes.

He understood her concern.

She worried Julian Langley might walk too fast for him to keep up.

Only then did Evelyn turn away with relief.

Before long, hurried footsteps echoed ahead.

Timothy Gold and Eugene York rushed over with the production crew, their faces tense with worry.

"Julian!" Timothy dashed forward, gripping the Oscar-winning actor's arms to inspect him. "You scared us half to death—"

His voice trembled.

No one expected to hear a scream from the acclaimed actor in the dead of night.

Beatrice Quincy pushed through the crowd, panting. "Are you hurt?"

She reached for Julian's arm.

The concerned stares made his ears burn.

"Just...startled." He awkwardly rubbed his nose.

That snake had nearly brushed against his face.

Never in his life had he felt so humiliated.

Julian shot Ethan a warning glare.

A single word about this would mean death.

Ethan arched a brow, amusement flickering in his gaze.

The commotion soon settled.

Evelyn explained the snake was nonvenomous and harmless unless provoked.

But the seed of fear had been planted.

Beatrice tossed and turned all night.

Every time she closed her eyes, phantom snakes slithered by her bedside.

At dawn's first light, she gave up on sleep.

She turned to see Bianca Fairchild sleeping soundly beside her.

Her eyes turned icy.

She dug her nails into the tender flesh of Bianca's inner arm.
###Chapter 314

"Ah!"

Bianca Fairchild jolted awake, her forehead glistening with cold sweat. Beatrice Quincy's exquisitely beautiful yet twisted face loomed inches from hers.

"Sleeping well, were you?" Beatrice pinched the tender flesh on Bianca's inner arm, her nails digging deep. "I couldn't sleep all night while you snored like a hog."

Bianca clenched her teeth, not daring to make a sound. The burns on her back from last night still throbbed painfully, now compounded by this fresh torment.

"Y-young Mistress..." Her voice trembled.

Beatrice suddenly yanked her hair hard. Bianca saw stars, nearly blacking out from the pain.

"Know your place." Beatrice hissed in her ear, each word dripping with venom. "If you dare upstage me on this reality show..."

She left the threat unfinished, but Bianca knew the consequences. Her grandmother's hospital bills still depended on the Quincy family's generosity.

"I understand." Bianca lowered her head, nails biting into her palms.

Beatrice grabbed her chin, forcing eye contact. "I hear my brother is joining the show." Her lips curled into a sneer. "If I catch you near him..."

"I won't!" Bianca shook her head frantically, face ashen.

Beatrice shoved her away and smoothed her silk robe. "I'm going back to sleep. Stand right there." She glanced at the corner camera. "Face away. Don't let them notice anything."

Bianca obeyed silently. Her legs trembled from standing too long, but she didn't dare move.

Dawn light filtered through the window. The other guests would wake soon. Bianca caught her pale reflection in the mirror and nearly laughed at the absurdity.

This was her life—forever in Beatrice's shadow, where even breathing felt like a transgression.

When Beatrice rolled over, Bianca stiffened, careful not to make a sound.

"Get me water." The command came without Beatrice opening her eyes.

Bianca moved soundlessly. The water had to be the perfect temperature—a lesson learned through years of experience.

As she handed over the glass, Beatrice's eyes snapped open. "You know what I hate most about you?" She took the cup. "This pathetic obedience."

The glass shattered against the wall beside Bianca's head, spraying shards.

"Fetch another."

Kneeling to collect the fragments, Bianca nicked her fingers. The memory surfaced unbidden—that rainy night a decade ago when the Quincys took her in.

"This is your home now."

How bitterly ironic.
###Chapter 315

8:00 AM sharp.

The live stream flickered to life.

With winter break coinciding with the weekend, viewership skyrocketed instantly.

Timothy Gold's signature grin filled the screen first. "Good morning, everyone! Season Two of Love Retreat is officially underway. Let's check in on our guests' morning routines."

The camera followed the crew's footsteps down the hallway.

Crystal Rothschild's room was first.

She opened the door rubbing sleep from her eyes, her hair slightly tousled. Spotting the camera, she brightened with a sugary smile. "Morning~"

Her husky morning voice carried the lazy warmth of a waking Ragdoll cat.

"Ten minutes till assembly," a crew member whispered.

She nodded obediently. Behind her, rumpled bedding peeked through the door crack.

[OMG! Flawless even barefaced!]
[That complexion though!]
[Eyelash goddess alert!]

The chat exploded with adoration.

The next few guests appeared alert and camera-ready.

Until they reached Evelyn Laurent's door.

Three unanswered knocks.

Crystal approached with her toiletry bag, tilting her head. "Evelyn must still be asleep." A glint of satisfaction flashed in her eyes. "Should we wake the others first?"

Timothy checked his watch and moved on.

Beatrice Quincy's door swung open.

She stood there in lilac loungewear, her makeup red-carpet perfect. "Good morning, everyone~"

Turning, she called into the room, "Xander, time to rise."

Xander Quincy emerged with bedhead, muttered "Morning," and retreated into shadows.

[Talk about sibling contrast!]
[Civilians have zero professionalism.]
[Where's Julian?! Show us Julian!]

Dread coiled in Timothy's gut as they reached Julian Langley's door.

Still no response after three knocks.

Beatrice gasped. "Don't tell me—"

Eugene York's face darkened.

The final doorknob turned under everyone's gaze.
###Chapter 316

The salty morning breeze carried through the air as Xander Quincy brewed coffee in his cabin.

His door swung open to reveal Timothy Gold peering inside. "Where's Ethan Sullivan?"

Xander stirred his cup, steam curling around his fingers as he glanced up. "Morning jog."

[OMG Ethan's discipline is insane!]
[That physique maintenance though—I'm jealous.]
[This couch potato is retreating under the covers in shame.]

The Danmu exploded with chatter, but a few venomous comments stood out.

[Bet Evelyn Laurent is still asleep.]
[Rich heiresses are so spoiled.]

Victoria Langley slammed her tablet down. "Absolute nonsense!"

Richard Langley patted his wife's back but kept his eyes on the screen. "Just wait for the comeback."

Outside the beach cabin, Rachel Clemenson feigned surprise. "Ethan's so diligent."

Crystal Rothschild nodded, her gaze drifting to a closed door. "Evelyn must be—"

"Looking for me?"

A cool voice cut through the air. The camera whipped around to capture three figures striding through the dawn light.

Evelyn's high ponytail swayed as her athletic wear accentuated her slender waist. Ethan's shirt clung to his damp chest, while Julian Langley toweled off his sweat.

[Holy trio alert!]
[That clapback came faster than a tornado.]

Timothy exhaled in relief. "So you all—"

"Five years and seven months," Evelyn interrupted. "Every morning at 5:20."

Julian shot Rachel a withering look. "Some people have quite the imagination."

Crystal dug her nails into her palm, forcing a smile. "We were just concerned—"

"Initial supplies distribution starts now," Timothy rushed to redirect. "Complete tasks for bonus prize draws."

Crew members wheeled out a spinning wheel, its prize list glinting under the sun.

"Everyone gets one basic supply draw first," Timothy added, wiping his brow. "Safety first."

Ethan's voice sliced through the chatter. "Evelyn and I will share our prize draws."

The clearing fell silent.
###Chapter 317

The prize wheel began to spin, marking the official start of the show.

The guests stepped forward one by one to draw their survival supplies.

Beatrice Quincy's team finished first, obtaining a flashlight, water bottle, lighter, and rope.

Crystal Rothschild's team followed closely, drawing a Swiss Army Knife, sleeping bag, shovel, and flashlight.

When it was Evelyn Laurent's turn, the wheel's pointer landed on a sleeping bag, iron pot, rope, and shovel.

"Perfect!" A sly glint flashed in Evelyn's eyes.

With these supplies plus her island survival kit, it was practically a dream start.

Even three months here wouldn't be a problem, let alone ten days.

The other two teams, however, looked troubled.

"Only one sleeping bag—how are we supposed to share?" someone in Crystal's team muttered under their breath.

Timothy Gold seized the moment to extend an olive branch. "Teams dissatisfied with their supplies can earn more resources by completing tasks."

Beatrice was the first to step forward. "I'll draw a mission card."

She elegantly pulled out a card and read aloud, "Find five types of wild island berries?"

"The island has a rich variety of edible wild berries," Timothy explained with a smile.

"Piece of cake." Beatrice confidently tossed her hair.

Back with her team, she asked for opinions. "Should we complete this together, or each draw our own tasks?"

Liam Croix adjusted his glasses. "I suggest everyone draws one task, then we divide the work."

Soon, all four members of Beatrice's team had drawn their mission cards.

Crystal's team also stepped forward to draw theirs.

Only Evelyn's team remained motionless.

Xander Quincy leaned lazily against a tree, his gaze occasionally drifting toward Bianca Fairchild.

Julian Langley and Ethan Sullivan both turned to look at Evelyn.

"Director Gold," Evelyn suddenly asked, "what's the ultimate goal of this episode?"

"Survive ten days and build a base." Timothy revealed three cards. "These are the base assignment cards."

Evelyn casually drew one—Base Three.

Beatrice got Base One, while Crystal received Base Two.

The three teams followed the crew to their respective territories.

The bases weren't far apart—each was an open area enclosed by a fence.

Backed by large trees with clear visibility, they had high safety ratings.

Evelyn scanned the surroundings, a smile curling her lips. "We don't need to do tasks."

She was already planning how to transform this space.

Here, she wouldn't just survive—she'd create her own paradise.
###Chapter 318

Evelyn Laurent's eyes sparkled as she surveyed the island before her.

"I'm going to build a camp here!" she announced excitedly.

Julian Langley affectionately ruffled her hair. "Whatever you say."

Ethan Sullivan immediately chimed in. "I'm fully on board."

Xander Quincy twirled a branch absentmindedly. "Whatever."

Timothy Gold gaped at them. "You're seriously abandoning the production crew's mission?"

"Absolutely!" Evelyn was already making plans. "Third brother, go gather seafood by the shore. Ethan and Xander, collect firewood."

The live stream chat exploded.

[Are they insane? Ignoring the assigned mission?]

[Does she think this is some make-believe game?]

[And Julian just agreed like that?]

[Who does this woman think she is, ordering them around?]

Evelyn paid no attention to the skeptical comments, humming a tune as she walked toward the beach with Julian.

Ethan watched her retreating figure and sighed helplessly.

"Let's go," he said, patting Xander's shoulder.

A flood of question marks filled the chat.

[???]

[They're actually following her orders?]

[What's Evelyn's deal anyway?]

[Sleeping her way to the top?]

Victoria Langley trembled with rage reading these malicious comments.

She immediately typed: [Don't you dare talk about my daughter like that!]

But her message was quickly buried.

Then a golden comment suddenly dominated the screen:

[Evelyn is the seventh daughter of the Langley family. Julian is her biological brother. ID: Alexander Langley]

The entire live stream went wild.

[Holy shit!!!]

[The Langleys? Those Langleys?!]

[No wonder Julian dotes on her so much!]

The chat's tone instantly shifted.

Meanwhile on the island, Evelyn was barefoot on the sand, joyful as a songbird.
###Chapter 319

The live stream room fell into an eerie silence.

Every viewer stared at the screen in shock.

Evelyn Laurent was actually the seventh daughter of the Langley family?!

The netizens who had been spewing insults earlier panicked.

[I was wrong! I didn’t know she was a Langley heiress! Please don’t cancel me!]

[Alexander Langley and Evelyn look so alike—how could I have accused her of plastic surgery? I must be blind!]

[Forgive me, Miss Langley! I’ll never talk nonsense again!]

The danmu was instantly flooded with apologies.

With Alexander Langley’s verified account personally stepping in, who would dare doubt the truth?

[Lillian Rothschild V: Scared now? Weren’t you having fun insulting her earlier? Keep going!]

Lillian and her friends unleashed a verbal assault.

Her fingers flew across the keyboard as she single-handedly crushed the anti-fans.

Alexander’s appearance was like a bucket of ice water, instantly extinguishing all the malice.

The danmu finally quieted down.

No one dared to utter another word about Evelyn.

Everyone in the industry knew the Langley patriarch’s ruthless reputation.

Crossing him meant an early end to one’s career.

Victoria Langley smirked in satisfaction.

Her eldest son had performed well this time.

Meanwhile, on the beach—

Evelyn ran barefoot across the sand.

The receding tide had left behind countless treasures.

Julian Langley trailed behind her with a cast-iron pot, grinning like an excited child.

"Evelyn! Look at this crab!"

"Wow! This fish is still flopping!"

"This seashell is gorgeous!"

Evelyn crouched down and poked the crab’s waving claws.

The turquoise waves lapped at her ankles.

Colorful starfish glittered under the sunlight.

This uninhabited island’s ecosystem was astonishingly pristine.

Julian had already gathered half a pot of seafood.

"Evelyn, are you sure all of this is edible?"

She blinked.

This was her first time beachcombing too.
###Chapter 320

Golden sunlight bathed the beach as gentle waves lapped at the shore. Evelyn Laurent and Julian Langley bent over, collecting seafood left behind by the receding tide. Their plastic bucket already held several crabs and shells.

Light footsteps approached from a distance.

Beatrice Quincy and Bianca Fairchild walked over, carrying the small red buckets provided by the production crew. Beatrice's eyes immediately landed on Julian's tall, straight-backed figure.

"Julian!" Her face lit up as she hurried forward.

Julian turned at the sound of her voice, instinctively hiding the pot filled with seafood behind him.

"You've gathered quite a haul," Beatrice remarked, her gaze lingering on the pot with a flicker of longing.

"This belongs to me and Evelyn," Julian replied coolly, taking a step closer to Evelyn.

Beatrice's smile froze. Her fingers tightened around the bucket handle.

"Of course I wouldn't take what's yours," she forced out, her voice trembling slightly.

Julian didn't respond, turning back to Evelyn, who was still gathering shells.

The cameras caught Beatrice's reddened eyes as she whispered to herself, "You can do this, Beatrice. Keep going."

[My heart aches for Beatrice! Julian is so cold to her.]
[Did Evelyn say something behind the scenes?]
[Wake up! Julian clearly doesn't want anything to do with Beatrice.]
[@LangleyLover: Taking notes on every ID that badmouths Evelyn~]

Suddenly, a bold message flashed across the livestream:

[Evelyn Laurent is the legitimate seventh daughter of the Langley family. Watch your words.]

The chat fell silent for a few seconds.

[Beatrice is the Quincy family's eldest daughter too!]
[Exactly! She's pursued Julian for so long. How can he treat her like this?]

On the beach, Beatrice took a deep breath and turned toward a rocky area. She crouched down, pretending to search for seafood, but her nails dug deep into her palms.
###Chapter 321

Beatrice Quincy's live stream erupted into chaos.

The comment section exploded with frenzied activity as two factions of fans clashed relentlessly.

Julian Langley's stans unleashed their fury:
"Got no shame, Beatrice?"
"Stop throwing yourself at our idol. Disgusting."
"Rejected a thousand times and still chasing him? Pathetic."

Beatrice's loyalists fired back:
"What kind of man is Julian anyway?"
"Too blind to see how amazing Beatrice is."
"Emotionless monster. Deserves to die alone."

Alexander Langley glanced at his phone screen and smirked.

His brother getting roasted? Whatever.

But if anyone dared insult his sister, he'd make them regret being born.

On the beach, Beatrice bit back tears.

Her nails dug into her palms as she clutched the plastic bucket.

The crab tongs felt awkward in her grip, each movement like torture.

Yet her gaze remained glued to Julian's retreating figure.

The shoreline had already been picked clean.

Bianca Fairchild approached timidly. "Should we try over there, sis?"

Her voice was barely audible.

A glacial glint flashed in Beatrice's eyes before she beamed sweetly. "How thoughtful, Bianca. Lead the way."

Bianca stiffened.

She walked ahead with rigid posture, head bowed.

Beatrice trailed leisurely behind, deliberately targeting spots Bianca had already searched.

Their buckets told contrasting stories.

Bianca's held only a few scattered shells.

Beatrice's overflowed with treasures.

"Oh my!" Beatrice suddenly gasped.

Kneeling, she cooed at a palm-sized crab with saccharine delight. "So adorable~"

Her fingertip grazed the crustacean's claw.

A bloodcurdling shriek ripped through the air.

"AAAAH—"

Beatrice flailed wildly as the crab clamped onto her index finger.

Crimson droplets splattered the sand.

Bianca lunged forward, expertly prying the claw open.

"Sis, you're supposed to avoid the pincers..."

Her voice faded to a whisper.

Cold sweat drenched her back.

Beatrice blinked tearfully. "Thank you, Bianca."

But those glistening eyes burned with venom.

This little bitch!

She knew the danger and left it for me on purpose?
###Chapter 322

A crimson drop of blood welled up on Beatrice Quincy's fingertip, glaringly vivid under the sunlight.

Her nails dug deep into her palms as she stared fixedly at the tiny wound.

This had to be that bitch Bianca Fairchild's doing!

"Beatrice, are you okay?" Bianca timidly offered a tissue.

Beatrice slapped her hand away, flashing a saccharine smile. "I'm fine, thanks for asking."

The crew rushed over, relieved to see it was just a minor cut.

The live chat exploded.

[Oh my god, Beatrice's hand! Why didn't the crew provide gloves?!]

[Who's to blame for poking a crab without common sense?]

[Bianca is so sweet, helping her with the wound.]

A shadow flickered in Beatrice's eyes as she glimpsed the comments.

She turned toward the shallows, deliberately stomping through Bianca's carefully collected pile of seashells.

"Oops, my bad." She blinked innocently.

Bianca silently knelt to gather the scattered shells again.

The salty sea breeze whipped against their faces.

Meanwhile, in another part of the bay...

Evelyn Laurent stood knee-deep in the water, rolling up her pants. The wooden spear she'd sharpened with her combat knife glinted coldly in the sun.

"Miss Evelyn is spearfishing? That's so badass!"

Julian Langley hugged an iron pot, his eyes sparkling like stars.

A school of fish drifted lazily past.

Evelyn struck—her spear slicing through the water.

Two silvery fish writhed on the wooden shaft, their tails flapping desperately.

"Only two?" She pursed her lips in dissatisfaction.

The chat flooded with awe.

[That was insane!]

[What kind of goddess is Evelyn Laurent?!]

[Others are still picking shells while she's out here catching dinner.]

Evelyn shook her damp bangs away, locking onto a denser school further out.

"Bro, we're having extra tonight."

A smirk curled her lips as she twirled the knife deftly between her fingers.
###Chapter 323

"Evelyn!" Julian Langley's eyes widened, nearly dropping the large pot in his hands. "You actually caught fish like that?"

He jumped excitedly on the spot before remembering he was still holding the pot, plopping down onto the sand and slapping the beach in disbelief. "This is incredible!"

The live stream's chat exploded instantly.

[What kind of god-tier move was that?!]

[I couldn't even do that in a video game!]

[Did Evelyn Laurent just cheat? Two fish at once?]

Evelyn remained composed, casually tossing the fish into the pot. "No big deal."

When she was eight, after her cousin's family moved away, the villagers occasionally helped, but most of the time, she had to fend for herself. Fishing in the river, setting traps for rabbits—these survival skills were ingrained in her bones.

"Teach me!" Julian's eyes sparkled as he stared at the sharpened wooden spear in her hand. "That move was amazing!"

Nearby, Beatrice Quincy clenched her fists.

This Evelyn was stealing the spotlight again. She watched the siblings' close interaction coldly, her nails digging into her palms.

"Xander, let's go." She picked up the basket filled with seafood, her voice tight with suppressed anger.

The ocean water was icy.

Julian shivered the moment he stepped in. "Evelyn, aren't you cold?"

"Used to it." She scattered some biscuit crumbs. "The fish will swim this way. You need to account for the refraction angle underwater."

The live audience held their breath.

[The Oscar-winning actor looks so serious.]

[I bet five bucks he misses.]

[I can't even breathe watching this.]

The school of fish approached slowly.

Julian held his breath, muscles tensed, and thrust the spear the moment the fish swam past—

"Splash!"

Water sprayed everywhere.

The fish scattered in panic.

The spear came up empty.
###Chapter 324

Julian Langley stood knee-deep in the stream, raising a wooden stick high before bringing it down with a splash.

"Missed again?" He stared at the water, disbelief coloring his voice.

Evelyn Laurent crouched on the bank, cleaning the fish she'd just speared. She glanced up at the commotion.

"Water refracts light, Julian," she said softly. "Aim slightly below where you see the fish."

Julian scratched his head and adjusted his stance. He took a deep breath, his focus sharp as if executing a critical mission.

First strike—water sprayed everywhere.
Second strike—the fish flicked its tail.
Third strike—the stick grazed scales.

"This defies physics!" Julian stared at his empty stick, shoulders slumping.

Evelyn tossed her fifth fish into the pot. Her movements were swift, each strike precise.

The live stream chat exploded:

[LMAO Julian's face is priceless]
[Is Evelyn cheating?]
[This is brutal hahaha]

Xander Quincy and Ethan Sullivan approached from a distance, taking in the scene.

"What's Julian doing?" Xander called out. "Practicing aquatic ballet?"

Ethan's gaze settled on Evelyn, his lips curving upward. But at Xander's words, his expression cooled instantly.

"What did you call her?" Ethan's voice dropped low.

Xander stiffened. "M-Miss Laurent?"

"Hmm." Ethan's acknowledgment was curt, his attention returning to Evelyn.

She looked up just then, meeting his eyes. With a bright smile, she held up her latest catch.

The chat went wild:

[OMG THAT EYE CONTACT]
[Ethan's gaze could melt glaciers]
[Someone call a priest—I'm witnessing holiness]

Julian remained oblivious to the tension onshore, still battling the stream. He raised his stick for the nth time, his expression tragically determined.

"I refuse to accept defeat!"
###Chapter 325

Sunlight danced on the ocean waves, casting shimmering reflections.

The live stream chat exploded with rapid-fire messages flooding the screen—endless variations of "So sweet!"

Victoria Langley sat before the monitor, an unconscious smile tugging at her lips.

She shook her head slightly. "That boy..."

Ethan Sullivan's devotion to Evelyn Laurent surpassed even her wildest expectations.

When the mystery guest was revealed to be Ethan, her breath hitched.

The CEO of Sullivan Group had abandoned his empire to chase Evelyn onto a reality show set.

He'd even become the program's primary sponsor.

Richard Langley narrowed his eyes.

Ethan's arrival came as no surprise.

That young man wasn't the type to surrender easily.

Once he recognized his own feelings, the elders wouldn't stand in his way.

But those six brothers...

Richard lifted his teacup, lips quirking upward.

Consider this Ethan's trial.

Without the brothers' approval, Evelyn would never say yes.

And more importantly...

Evelyn herself remained blissfully oblivious.

Ethan's path would be long and arduous.

May he have the perseverance to endure.

Waves crashed against the shoreline.

Julian Langley whirled at the sound of approaching footsteps.

Xander Quincy and Ethan were walking toward the beach.

His eyes gleamed as he raised a wooden spear. "Care to try spearfishing?"

His gaze locked onto Ethan.

Take the bait.

Make a fool of yourself.

Xander already rolled up his pant legs with enthusiasm. "I'm in!"

Ethan methodically folded back his sleeves.

The motion carried the elegance of a gala dinner.

"Coming, third brother."

He waded into the surf, heading straight for Evelyn.

"The water's cold. Let me."

His voice dripped with honeyed warmth.

Evelyn thrust the spear forward without hesitation. "Do you even know how?"

Ethan shook his head, gaze intent. "Teach me?"

Julian lunged between them. "I'll teach you!"

No alone time for these two.

Ethan's eyes flicked to the iron pot onshore.

Eight fish lay in perfect alignment, each pierced through identical spots.

Clearly Evelyn's handiwork.

He turned to Julian with earnest curiosity. "Does third brother's method actually work?"

Julian's face froze.

That bastard!
###Chapter 326

Julian Langley shot Ethan Sullivan a murderous glare, about to lash out when Evelyn Laurent's clear voice cut through. "Let me demonstrate."

She motioned for them to step back, gripping the wooden spear firmly as she waded into the shallows.

Gentle waves lapped at her ankles.

As a school of fish darted past, her wrist flicked with lightning speed. The spear plunged into the water.

Two plump fish writhed on the spear's tip, their tails flapping desperately.

"See how it's done?" She lifted the spear, sunlight refracting through the droplets clinging to it.

Ethan watched the sea breeze tousle her hair, a faint smile curving his lips. "Mm."

Xander Quincy eagerly grabbed the spear and charged into the water.

Julian lounged on the sand, smirking. "Good luck with that."

He knew exactly how difficult spearfishing could be.

Her combat knife flashed as she swiftly assembled a makeshift grill.

"Yes. Everyone's hungry." Her hands moved deftly scaling the fish.

Julian frowned. "No fire starter."

"I've got it covered." She didn't look up.

"Beatrice's team has a lighter," Julian suggested.

Evelyn's hands stilled. "Send Xander to borrow it."

She didn't want her brother getting involved with Beatrice Quincy.

Julian's eyes lit up. He called toward the water, "Xander! Evelyn needs you to get a lighter!"

The struggling spearfisherman turned with a scowl. "Why don't you go yourself?"

Evelyn had secretly tugged his sleeve earlier, signaling him not to go.

###Chapter 328

###Chapter 330

Evelyn Laurent and Julian Langley strolled leisurely along the forest path, gathering a bounty of wild edibles without realizing it.

The mushrooms were plump and fresh, the wild greens vibrant, and the berries ripe and tempting—enough to feed four people.

Julian instinctively stepped back, shielding the bundle. "If Evelyn says they're safe, then they are."

Rachel gaped at him, incredulous. She'd done her research—Evelyn was just some country bumpkin with no credentials. How could an Oscar-winning actor trust her judgment?

"Julian, I'm serious! Those mushrooms are deadly!" Rachel insisted. "Leo and I grew up in the countryside. We know these things."

Leo nodded vigorously. "Yeah, we call those 'Devil's Bane.' One bite is enough to kill you."

Evelyn stood quietly, a faint smile playing on her lips. She plucked one mushroom from the bundle, twirling it between her fingers.

"Are you sure?" Her voice was soft but laced with unshakable confidence.

Rachel bristled at her tone. "Evelyn, stop pretending you know what you're doing! This is a matter of life and death!"

Tension crackled in the air. Crystal watched from a distance, amusement flickering in her eyes, while Hugo studied the mushroom in Evelyn's hand thoughtfully.

Julian suddenly chuckled. "I trust Evelyn's judgment." He turned to her, his gaze warm and resolute. "Let's head back. It's time to start lunch."

Rachel's face flushed with frustration. She'd hoped to showcase her survival skills on camera, only to have Julian side with Evelyn so decisively.

"You'll regret this!" she called after them.

Evelyn waved without looking back. "Thanks for your concern." Her tone was breezy, as if discussing the weather.

The pair walked away, leaving the Clemenson siblings standing there. Leo muttered, "Do you think they'll really eat those poisonous mushrooms?"

Rachel gritted her teeth. "Let's see them make fools of themselves!" She was already plotting how to play the compassionate expert if Evelyn got poisoned.

Meanwhile, Evelyn murmured to Julian, "Those are called 'Scarlet Caps.' They are toxic."

Julian paused mid-step. "Then why—"

"But I know how to prepare them safely." Evelyn flashed a mysterious smile. "You'll see."

From afar, Crystal watched their retreating figures, stroking her chin thoughtfully. This mushroom dispute seemed far more layered than it appeared.
