Xander stole a glance at Ethan Sullivan and Julian Langley's expressions before murmuring, "I shouldn't have asked you that earlier."

"Why?" Evelyn looked even more perplexed.

Ethan's mellow voice intervened, "He didn't want to trigger painful memories."

His gaze lingered on Evelyn's profile, heartache rippling in his eyes.

The mere thought of her past suffering twisted his heart like a knife.

But Evelyn simply uttered a soft "Oh."

"Not at all."

Those hardships were long behind her now.

Apart from the darkness under Vincent Lowell's roof and the kidnapping nightmare, most of her life—

Had been spent making others tremble in fear.

Street thugs fled at the sight of her, even offering tributes voluntarily.

She just couldn't be bothered to bully the weak.

The topic was swiftly brushed aside.

Evelyn crouched to sort through vines, joined by Julian and Xander.

Suddenly, Julian yelped and leaped back. "Bugs!"

The vine crevices teemed with swarms of insects, a nauseating spectacle.

Evelyn calmly poked at them. "Harmless. Toss them aside—they make good fish bait."

After brief instructions on vine processing, she turned to grind medicinal herbs.

The insect-repellent sachets needed urgent completion. Fewer pests meant smoother travels deeper into the island.

At least the snakes and critters would steer clear.

Meanwhile, Beatrice Quincy's team still struggled with basic survival.

Bianca Fairchild could only manage light chores due to her condition.

The pampered Quincy heiress nearly started a wildfire just trying to light a fire.

"Sorry..." She stood red-eyed, fingers twisting her hem.

Liam and Lucas Croix frantically stamped out the flames before reassuring her, "It's fine, Beatrice."

The brothers exchanged exasperated looks.

This Oscar-winning actress demanded both screen time and her delicate persona, leaving the grueling work to them.

Yet they had to keep smiling—she was, after all, the Quincy heiress and A-list celebrity.

Their mission progress suffered severely as a result.
###Chapter 342

Liam's gaze swept over Evelyn's group, noting the abundance of vines they'd gathered.

He turned to the Quincy sisters. "Beatrice, why don't you two collect some dry grass or vines for bedding?"

After a pause, he added, "My brother and I will go fishing."

Beatrice nodded obediently. "Of course."

She turned to Bianca. "Let's go, Bianca."

It wasn't a suggestion—it was an order.

Bianca's head spun, but she didn't dare argue. Silently, she picked up a rope and followed.

Once they'd walked a distance, Beatrice carelessly hacked at some grass. Spotting denser vegetation ahead, her eyes lit up. "Over there. More grass."

Bianca hesitated, eyeing the untamed area. "Beatrice, there could be snakes. It's not safe—"

Beatrice's expression darkened. "Since when are you so cowardly?"

"If you can't handle a simple task, how will I explain that to Liam?"

"If you're feeling unwell, stay here."

With that, she strode off, a cold glint in her eyes.

How dare this little bitch talk back?

Bianca bit her lip but followed anyway.

She couldn't let anything happen to Beatrice—she'd be the one to suffer for it.

Beatrice fumbled with her combat knife, clumsily cutting grass.

After gathering just a small bundle, her arms already ached.

Bianca worked slower but persisted.

"Take a break if you're tired," Beatrice said with false concern.

Bianca forced herself to speed up. "I'm fine."

[Why is Bianca putting on an act? Trying to slack off again?]

[Disgusting. Get her off the show already!]

[Poor Beatrice, stuck with such deadweight!]

The live stream flooded with vitriol.

Bianca carefully selected plants while Beatrice hacked haphazardly.

When they returned to camp with their bundles, Beatrice suddenly shrieked, dropping her load.

"Ah! My back—it burns!"

Tears welled as searing pain shot through her.
###Chapter 343

Agony crashed over Beatrice Quincy like tidal waves. A million fire ants seemed to be gnawing at her back.

"Ah—"

A bloodcurdling scream tore from her throat as she curled into a fetal position.

The excruciating itch drove her nearly mad. Her hands twitched uncontrollably, desperate to claw at her skin.

"Don't move!"

Bianca Fairchild seized her wrists with surprising strength.

Her pupils contracted sharply when she glimpsed Beatrice's back—an ominous rash was spreading visibly across the skin.

"Those plants," she said tightly. "Liam, call the medics now!"

The Croix brothers paled, fumbling for their walkie-talkies.

"Let me go!" Beatrice thrashed violently, tears and snot smearing her face. "You did this on purpose, didn't you? Why only me—"

SMACK!

The sharp slap silenced her mid-sentence.

Bianca's palm stung, but her voice was glacial. "Keep struggling and you'll never wear backless dresses again."

The blow stunned Beatrice into silence.

She gaped at this unfamiliar version of her sister, suddenly realizing she'd almost shattered her carefully crafted image on camera.

"I...it hurts so much..." Instantly switching tactics, she summoned tears on command, adopting a pitiful whimper.

The live chat exploded:

[Holy shit Bianca's a badass!]

[That reaction time! Beatrice would've shredded her back without her.]

[Fake much? Clearly Bianca poisoned her!]

[Open your eyes! Even Bianca's got scratches on her hand.]

Beads of sweat dotted Bianca's temples as she restrained her writhing sister.

Her gaze darkened when she noticed faint red marks emerging on her own hand.

Those plants...were definitely toxic.
###Chapter 344

"Ahhh—"

Beatrice Quincy's piercing scream tore through the jungle.

The danmu exploded instantly.

[WTF! What's Bianca doing? She's grabbing Beatrice's hand!]

[Oh my God! Beatrice's back is covered in rashes! That bitch Bianca!]

[Is the production crew dead? Save her now!]

Liam and Lucas Croix looked up sharply from gathering wild berries.

"That's Beatrice!"

They exchanged glances and immediately dropped their baskets, sprinting toward the sound.

Timothy Gold and Eugene York collided with the medical team head-on.

"Hurry! Beatrice is in trouble!"

Medics charged forward with a stretcher.

Xander Quincy's hands froze mid-knot as he set up the tent.

"Beatrice!"

He abandoned the ropes and bolted toward the screams.

Evelyn Laurent's group was collecting water by the stream.

"What's happening?"

Chu Mingyue's canteen slipped into the water with a splash.

All three took off running without retrieving it.

Deep in the jungle, Beatrice knelt trembling.

Angry red welts covered her back, oozing blood where fabric rubbed against them.

Bianca Fairchild gripped her wrist tightly.

"Don't touch it! You'll spread the infection!"

"Let me go!" Beatrice sobbed, writhing in pain. "It hurts so much, brother!"

Xander burst into the clearing to this horrific scene.

His pupils contracted violently.

"Bianca!"

His enraged roar sent birds scattering from the trees.

Bianca looked up calmly. "She touched poison ivy."

Evelyn arrived panting, her eyes scanning the vegetation.

Suddenly she crouched, using a stick to part a tangle of vines.

"Giant hogweed!"

The plant's toxic hairs glinted ominously in the sunlight.

"Contact causes severe dermatitis. We need to treat this immediately!"

The medical team finally arrived.

"Clear the area!"

They swiftly erected an isolation tent.

Beatrice whimpered as they helped her inside. "Brother...will I be scarred?"

The moment the tent zipper closed, Xander punched a tree.

"Why didn't anyone warn us about this hazard?"

He glared daggers at Bianca.

The danmu went wild again.

[Did Bianca do this on purpose?]

[If she hadn't stopped her, Beatrice would've scratched her skin raw!]

[The producers owe us an explanation!]

Crystal Rothschild's group arrived just as agonized screams tore from the tent.

"Please...gentler..."

Beatrice's cries cut through everyone like knives.

A medic emerged grim-faced. "She needs emergency evacuation."

Timothy immediately pulled out a satellite phone.

Xander barged inside to find his sister prone on the stretcher, her back a horrifying landscape of weeping sores.

"Beatrice..."

His voice shook.

She lifted tear-filled eyes. "I'm so scared..."

Outside, Bianca stood motionless.

A giant hogweed leaf crumpled in her fist, her expression unreadable.

Evelyn approached. "You knew about this?"

Bianca opened her hand, letting the leaf flutter to the ground.

"I do now."
###Chapter 345

Xander Quincy gently patted Beatrice Quincy's back until her sobs gradually subsided.

Bianca Fairchild stood in the corner, her gaze shifting between them. She pressed her lips together, fingers unconsciously twisting the hem of her shirt.

Evelyn Laurent approached silently and suddenly grasped Bianca's wrist.

"Don't move." Evelyn's tone brooked no argument.

She rolled up Bianca's sleeve, revealing reddened skin and several bleeding scratches.

"Ointment." Evelyn extended a hand toward Timothy Gold.

The salve was quickly passed to Ethan Sullivan. Evelyn's movements were gentle as she dabbed the medicine onto the wounds with her fingertips.

"Why didn't you say anything?" She locked eyes with Bianca. "These could scar."

Bianca flinched and withdrew her arm, her voice barely audible. "I... I'm fine."

She kept her head down as if trying to disappear into the floor—a stark contrast to her earlier composed demeanor.

Evelyn frowned, catching Xander's hesitant expression from the corner of her eye.

Beatrice clung to Xander, tearfully glancing at Julian Langley, who remained focused on Evelyn.

The production crew was in chaos.

Timothy wiped sweat from his brow and suggested, "Should we... switch Xander and Bianca's groups?"

Beatrice clearly wasn't in any state to continue filming, and Xander was her only anchor.

As for moving Beatrice to Julian's team? Timothy inwardly shook his head. Everyone knew Julian had been avoiding the young socialite.
###Chapter 346

Beads of sweat formed on Director Timothy Gold's forehead. His fingers tapped nervously against his knee as he stared at Beatrice Quincy's pale face on the monitor. If Beatrice continued filming with Julian Langley's team, this show might end prematurely.

Beatrice's eyelashes fluttered as she prepared to refuse. But Xander Quincy spoke first. "Fine."

"Let Beatrice rest. I'll switch teams."

His gaze remained fixed on Beatrice. The faint red rash visible on her back made his heart clench. His pampered younger sister looked so fragile, as if she might shatter at the slightest touch.

Evelyn Laurent suddenly chuckled, tapping Xander's reddened arm. "Xander, your real sister is injured too."

Bianca Fairchild's head jerked up, pupils dilating in panic. She shook her head frantically at Evelyn, nails digging into her palms. Mentioning her now would only worsen the situation.

Xander stiffened, his eyes shifting to Bianca's inflamed arm. The angry redness made him instinctively rise—until a pained whimper stopped him mid-step.

"Brother...it hurts..." Beatrice curled into herself, tears clinging to her lashes.

Xander immediately turned back, supporting her gently. "Where does it hurt? Should I call a doctor?"

Evelyn watched the scene coldly before yanking Bianca's wrist. "Let's go. We've seen enough."

Beatrice glared at Evelyn's retreating back, teeth grinding. That meddlesome woman kept ruining her plans.

Julian Langley and Ethan Sullivan followed Evelyn without sparing Beatrice a glance. Only the sound of Timothy wiping sweat remained. "Everyone, please be careful! Stop filming immediately if you feel unwell!"

He touched his neck in relief. Thank God it was just an allergy. A real accident would have ended his career on this godforsaken island.

Live stream comments exploded:

[That was terrifying! Thought something serious happened]

[Xander treats his sisters so differently!]

[Bianca deserves it! She must've caused Beatrice's allergy]

[Pretty sure Beatrice faked it. Xander was about to check on Bianca]

[Are you blind? Beatrice was clearly suffering]

In the Quincy mansion, a crystal glass shattered against the TV screen.

"That worthless bastard!" Mrs. Quincy's nails dug into the sofa. "She can't even take care of Beatrice properly!"

Mr. Quincy narrowed his eyes like a predator. "Seems our last lesson wasn't enough." He pulled out his phone. "Tell the hospital to increase the dosage."

On screen, Bianca trailed behind Evelyn with her head down. No one saw the fleeting smirk on her lips.
###Chapter 347

Evelyn Laurent gripped Bianca Fairchild's wrist and pulled her back.

Bianca's arm was taut as a bowstring at first, but gradually relaxed as they walked further.

Ethan Sullivan and Julian Langley followed in silence.

Back at camp, Evelyn swiftly set up the tent. Julian moved to help, but Ethan was already reaching for the poles.

"Mic off," Evelyn said curtly, switching off both her and Bianca's lavalier mics.

She shot Ethan a meaningful look before dragging Bianca inside the tent.

Ethan positioned himself at the entrance. When a cameraman approached, his voice turned icy. "The ladies need privacy."

The crew member backed away immediately.

Julian finally caught on, raking a hand through his hair in frustration. He hadn't grasped his sister's cue fast enough.

"Julian." Ethan picked up the vines. "Let's get back to work."

They moved a short distance away to sort the vines. Ethan's slender fingers worked deftly through the strands while Julian, though less skilled, quickly matched his rhythm.

The sun had warmed the vines, sending tiny insects scuttling from the crevices. No one wanted to wake up bitten in the middle of the night.

Inside the tent, Evelyn sat cross-legged.

Bianca twisted her fingers anxiously.

"What does the Quincy family have on you?" Evelyn cut straight to the point.

Bianca's head jerked up, lips trembling. After a long pause, her voice came out hoarse. "My grandmother..."

Tears splashed onto the back of her hands.

Since childhood, she'd been trapped as Beatrice Quincy's plaything. Her grandmother's medical bills were a noose around her neck, choking her breath away.

The slightest displeasure from Beatrice meant her grandmother's treatment would be cut off.
###Chapter 348

Bianca's fingers twisted the hem of her dress unconsciously, her knuckles turning white.

She kept her head down, her voice barely audible. "The Quincy family... was never my home."

Evelyn's eyelashes fluttered slightly.

Bianca's shoulders trembled. "Ever since I can remember, I knew I was just Beatrice's shadow. I couldn't fight back when she hit or insulted me."

Sunlight slanted through the window, casting pale light across her ashen face.

Evelyn noticed a faint scar on her wrist.

"What's this—"

Bianca instinctively pulled her hand back. "Beatrice cut me with a fruit knife last year. She said it would bring her good luck."

Evelyn's pupils contracted sharply.

She suddenly remembered how Bianca always wore long sleeves when they first met.

"What about your grandmother?" Evelyn asked softly.

Tears spilled from Bianca's eyes without warning. "They locked her away in a private nursing home..."

Her voice cracked. "She was the only one who ever cared about me."

Evelyn seized her hand. "Give me the address."

Bianca looked up abruptly, a flicker of hope in her eyes.

"After the show ends," Evelyn said quietly but firmly, "my parents will help you."

Bianca's tears fell in heavy drops.

She bit her lip hard to stifle her sobs.

"Why... help me?"

Evelyn gazed out the window. "Because I was once..."

She didn't finish, but Bianca understood.

The two girls sat in silence under the sunlight.

"Xander..." Evelyn suddenly spoke.

Bianca visibly stiffened.

"He's different," she murmured. "He knows I'm not his real sister, but..."

Her eyes glazed over momentarily.

The boy who once handed her candy now avoided her like the plague.

"He showed you kindness," Evelyn said pointedly.

Bianca smiled bitterly. "That's what makes it worse."

She wiped her face. "None of that matters now."

Evelyn studied her thoughtfully. "Not necessarily."

Bianca looked up in confusion.

"Some things," Evelyn said meaningfully, "aren't always what they seem."

She stood and extended her hand. "Let's deal with the immediate problem first."

Bianca hesitated before finally taking her hand.

Sunlight illuminated their clasped fingers.

At that moment, the gears of fate began to turn.
###Chapter 349

Bianca Fairchild thought this love would remain buried in the darkest corner of her heart forever.

But Beatrice Quincy saw right through her.

That afternoon, Beatrice stormed into her room and hurled her diary onto the floor. Pink pages scattered everywhere, each one filled with Xander Quincy's name.

"Slut!" Beatrice's palm struck her cheek with a sharp crack. "How dare you lust after my brother?"

The Quincy parents rushed in at the commotion. Their eyes turned icy when they saw the diary pages, as if gazing at something vile.

"After all we've done for you, this is how you repay us?" Mrs. Quincy's voice cut like glass.

The physical pain paled in comparison to Xander standing there, watching coldly.

His gaze made her feel like a filthy rodent.

"Don't let me see you again." Those were his last words to her.

From that day on, Xander became a regular at nightclubs. Tabloids overflowed with photos of him entangled with different women. Each time they crossed paths, he'd glare at her with undisguised revulsion.

Once, she gathered the courage to approach him. He humiliated her publicly: "Get lost. You make me sick."

Bianca's hope died completely.

Until that rainy night.

She found a drunken Xander outside a convenience store. Alcohol clung to him, but his eyes burned unnaturally bright.

"Bianca..." His grip on her wrist was painfully tight.

That night, Xander transformed. He whispered her name with tenderness, as if she were something precious.

By dawn, he dressed without a backward glance, leaving no trace of their intimacy.

Bianca clenched her fists, nails biting into her palms.

"Xander and I... we're nothing." Her voice cracked on the lie.

How could they be?

She was the Quincy family's charity case—Beatrice's human luck charm. Their parents made it clear: trash like her wasn't fit to lick Xander's shoes.

And technically, they were siblings.

Evelyn Laurent gently embraced her trembling shoulders.

"They're the unworthy ones." Evelyn's quiet words pierced Bianca's darkness like sunlight.

Suddenly, Bianca laughed.

Tears still streaked her face, but her smile was genuine.

"You're right." She wiped her cheeks. "Let's go."

Years of practice had taught her to lock her true self behind masks. Yet for the first time, she felt light.

Evelyn didn't know it, but that hug marked Bianca's rebirth.
###Chapter 350

The moment the microphone turned back on, Bianca Fairchild straightened her spine.

A faint smile played on her lips, her eyes sparkling like stars.

Ethan Sullivan's vines paused mid-motion.

He studied Bianca with subtle surprise flickering in his gaze.

That bastard Xander Quincy was finally getting what he deserved.

Served him right.

The four of them worked in perfect sync, quickly organizing the vines.

Emerald tendrils carpeted the ground like a vibrant forest.

"We need more," Evelyn Laurent glanced around. "I'll go cut some."

"I'll come with you," Ethan immediately offered.

Bianca spoke at the same time. "Me too."

Evelyn smiled warmly. "Ethan can go with me. Bianca, help my third brother dry the vines."

Her tone was gentle as spring water.

A stark contrast to the icy demeanor she showed Beatrice Quincy.

"Okay!" Bianca beamed.

[OMG! Did Bianca just transform into a different person?]

[What did Evelyn say to her? She's glowing now!]

[She's so beautiful when she smiles. Why was she always hiding before?]

[She used to be such a doormat around Beatrice. This is a complete 180!]

The danmu exploded with comments.

Viewers' perceptions of Bianca were shifting in real time.

In the studio, Victoria Langley gently squeezed her husband's hand.

"Evelyn's friend needs our help."

Richard Langley's gaze darkened. "We're already investigating what the Quincys have on her."

"With the live stream still running, the Quincys must be panicking."

Victoria's heart ached as she watched the screen. "Such a sweet girl, ruined by that family."

"And that spoiled Beatrice—completely lawless."

Both were pampered heiresses, yet their Evelyn would never bully others.

Richard patted his wife's hand reassuringly. "Don't worry. We'll get justice for her."

Meanwhile, Evelyn and Ethan arrived at their usual gathering spot.

Only to find Rachel Clemenson's team already there.

Leo Clemenson and Hugo Rothschild were cutting vines.

Crystal Rothschild looked pale as she sorted them, fingers trembling slightly.

Rachel worked through her nausea, processing vines at record speed.

She had to outperform Crystal.

This was her last chance.
###Chapter 351

Evelyn Laurent's gaze swept indifferently over the group.

Her lips pressed into a thin line as she strode toward the overgrown vines.

Ethan Sullivan followed closely behind.

The two began harvesting the vines with seamless coordination.

Hugo Rothschild worked alone on the opposite side.

His movements were swift but noticeably slower than Evelyn's rhythm.

Evelyn's wrist flicked with precision.

The combat knife traced silver arcs through the sunlight.

Vines snapped like fragile threads beneath her skilled hands.

Ethan gracefully gathered the cut vines with fluid motions.

Their teamwork resembled a meticulously choreographed dance.

Hugo's pupils constricted sharply.

His gaze locked onto Evelyn's nimble fingers.

His Adam's apple bobbed involuntarily.

This woman... was an absolute monster.

His jaw clenched as he tightened his grip.

The vines groaned before snapping under excessive force.

Leo Clemenson paused, panting heavily.

His eyes darted between the two groups.

"Making a woman do such rough work..." he muttered under his breath.

Two razor-sharp gazes instantly pinned him in place.

Leo froze as cold sweat drenched his back.

Those piercing stares seemed to see through his very soul.

Evelyn suddenly tossed her combat knife toward Ethan.

"Catch."

The blade flashed cold steel through the air.

"Watch out!"

Crystal Rothschild and Rachel Clemenson screamed simultaneously.

Ethan's slender fingers caught the hilt with effortless precision.

"Tired?" he asked softly.

Evelyn gave a casual nod before sitting beneath a tree's shade.

Crystal's face paled.

"Do you realize how dangerous that was?"

Rachel frowned in agreement.

"What if Mr. Sullivan got hurt?"

Evelyn lifted icy eyes.

"You think I'd miss?"

Her voice dripped with frost.

Crystal stumbled half a step backward.

Rachel opened her mouth but ultimately closed it in sullen silence.
###Chapter 352

Evelyn Laurent twirled the combat knife between her fingers. The blade glinted coldly in the sunlight.

She knew Ethan Sullivan too well.

For him, catching a knife thrown with this precision was as easy as catching a falling leaf.

The knife cut through the air in a straight silver line, its trajectory calculated to perfection.

But Rachel Clemenson and Crystal Rothschild screamed as if they'd seen a ghost.

"Evelyn Laurent! Have you lost your mind?" Rachel covered her mouth, her eyes wide with shock.

Evelyn smirked.

Did these people really think so highly of themselves?

Leo Clemenson immediately jumped in to accuse her. "You're playing with people's lives!"

"None of your business." Evelyn's gaze turned icy. "Who do you think you are?"

Leo's face paled instantly.

He clenched his fists, his voice trembling. "What if you hit Mr. Sullivan? Could you bear that responsibility?"

Ethan chuckled softly.

He effortlessly tossed the knife back to Evelyn with fluid grace.

"Mr. Clemenson," Ethan said coolly, "Evelyn and I handle our own affairs. Outsiders need not interfere."

Leo was instantly silenced.

He glared at Evelyn with venomous hatred burning in his eyes.

How dare this bitch?

Was it just because she had Ethan's backing?

Evelyn caught his malicious stare instantly.

"Keep looking," she slowly raised the knife, pointing the tip directly at Leo, "and I'll make sure you never see daylight again."

The live stream exploded.

[How arrogant! Threatening someone in public?]

[She threw the knife first and still acts righteous?]

[Leo's glare was disgusting. I'd snap too.]

[Mr. Sullivan said it's just how they interact. Mind your own business.]

[Rachel and her brother are clearly targeting Evelyn. Think we're blind?]

Evelyn sheathed the knife and turned toward the depths of the jungle.

She had no patience for these clowns.

Ethan quickly followed, their figures gradually disappearing from the camera's view.

Rachel bit her lip hard.

Her nails dug deep into her palms.

This Evelyn Laurent was far more formidable than she'd anticipated.
###Chapter 353

Leo Clemenson froze in place, his blood turning to ice.

Evelyn Laurent's gaze was like a poisoned dagger, piercing straight into his soul.

"Evelyn!" Rachel Clemenson yanked her brother behind her, her voice shrill with panic. "Have you lost your mind? We live in a society governed by law!"

Her chest heaved violently, nails digging into her palms.

Crystal Rothschild bit her lower lip, her voice soft and hesitant. "Evelyn, that kind of talk is really inappropriate..." Her lashes fluttered. "Leo was just worried about you."

Evelyn scoffed and turned to leave.

"Stop." Ethan Sullivan's voice cut through the air.

He stepped slowly toward Rachel, his presence suffocating. "Who gave you the right to dictate terms to my woman?"

The combat knife glinted coldly in the sunlight.

"If I hear one more word—" Ethan's lips curled into a smile, but his eyes remained frozen. "I won't hesitate to silence you myself."

Rachel paled, stumbling back half a step.

The next moment, Ethan turned and took Evelyn's hand, his voice instantly softening. "Come on, let's get back to work."

Hugo Rothschild remained silent in the shadows.

His knuckles whitened around his knife, his gaze locked onto Evelyn.

Both men swung their blades at the vines.

The clash of steel carried an unspoken tension, thick as gunpowder in the air.

"Snake." Evelyn paused abruptly, not bothering to turn.

Crystal shrieked and jumped back.

"Don't worry!" Rachel forced a steady tone. "I used to catch snakes back home—"

Her voice trailed off as she met Hugo's icy glare.

Crystal clutched Rachel's sleeve. "C-can we just go back?"

No one answered.

Only the rhythmic sound of blades slicing through vines echoed through the jungle. Hugo's strikes grew faster, yet he couldn't close the distance between himself and that unwavering figure ahead.
###Chapter 354

Hugo Rothschild was utterly outmatched in front of Ethan Sullivan.

What he considered a rivalry wasn't even acknowledged with a glance.

Crystal Rothschild paled. Rachel and Leo Clemenson exchanged reluctant nods.

The four gathered their vines and returned to camp.

Evelyn Laurent's team had become the gold standard for the other groups.

Whenever they felt lost, observing Evelyn's team provided answers.

Like weaving mats from vines.

Beatrice Quincy, meanwhile, became a cautionary tale.

Her painful mishap taught everyone which plants to avoid.

Injured and immobilized, Beatrice forced Xander Quincy to gather vines with the Croix brothers.

Despite setbacks, all three teams finally found their rhythm.

Timothy Gold breathed a sigh of relief.

Only after medics confirmed Beatrice's rash was temporary would she stop complaining.

But Bianca Fairchild seized the chance to join Evelyn's team.

The thought made Beatrice grind her teeth.

Though she got Xander in exchange, she coveted Evelyn's group.

Julian Langley was there.

He was the sole reason she'd joined this mediocre show.

The cast was full of nobodies—even civilians.

This program was merely her stepping stone to Julian.

Beatrice touched her back.

The bumpy texture made her shudder. She couldn't bear to look.

"Bianca Fairchild!"

She spat the name like poison, eyes burning with malice.

Now she was certain—that little bitch had sabotaged her deliberately.

No cameras. No mics. Just the privacy of her tent.

Beatrice stormed out, heading straight for production.

Timothy's face fell at her approach.

What fresh hell did this diva want now?

Before he could react, she barged in.

"Assistant director! Give me my phone back!"

Confirming no cameras were rolling, Beatrice thrust out her hand imperiously.
###Chapter 355

Timothy Gold's face darkened as his fingers drummed absently on the desk.

"The rules are clear, Miss Quincy." He lifted his gaze to meet Beatrice Quincy's. "No phone usage during filming."

Beatrice slammed her palms on the table, her manicured nails screeching across the surface.

"My leg is injured like this, and you won't even let me make a call?" Her voice turned shrill. "Think carefully about the consequences, Timothy."

Timothy remained unmoved, his eyes glacial.

"Rules are rules."

Beatrice's chest heaved with barely contained fury. She hadn't expected this minor director to dare stand up to her.

"You think having Vincent Lowell's backing makes you untouchable?" She sneered. "I could ruin your career in this industry with one word."

Eugene York arrived just in time to hear the threat.

"Director Gold..." He hesitated.

Timothy waved him off.

"Miss Quincy is free to quit anytime." His tone remained even. "The yacht stands ready around the clock."

A flicker of hesitation crossed Beatrice's eyes. Leaving meant forfeiting exposure from this hit reality show.

"Fine. Very well!" She ground her teeth. "We'll see about this!"

Her stilettos struck the floor like gunshots as she stormed away.

Eugene watched her retreating figure with concern.

"Director Gold, the Quincy family has considerable influence..."

Timothy lit a cigarette and took a deep drag.

"I'm more concerned about Mr. Sullivan and Vincent Lowell's stance." His expression blurred behind the smoke. "Every arrangement on this island was personally approved by Mr. Sullivan."

Only then did Eugene notice the Sullivan Group logo on the distant yacht.

"The medical team consists of top specialists from Sullivan Hospital. The security system is provided by Lowell Technologies." Timothy tapped his cigarette. "Do you really think the Quincys can reach here?"

The sea breeze carried a briny tang.

Understanding dawned on Eugene, his tense shoulders relaxing.

"So Beatrice's injury..."

"Superficial." Timothy stubbed out his cigarette. "The doctor confirmed it won't even leave a scar."

The distant sound of shattering objects made them exchange knowing smiles.

On this isolated island, even the Quincy heiress had to play by the rules.
###Chapter 356

Timothy Gold leaned lazily against the tent with an indifferent smile. "Julian Langley is my brother. You think he'd let anything happen to me?"

His confidence was well-founded.

When Julian first entered the entertainment industry, it was Timothy who recognized his potential. He single-handedly propelled the inexperienced young man onto variety show stages. From obscurity to Oscar-winning actor, every step bore Timothy's influence.

That bond wasn't something Julian would forget.

Later, when Timothy learned Julian was actually the third son of the Langley family, he merely raised an eyebrow. Their friendship had never required status to sustain it.

Did Beatrice Quincy really think she could stir up trouble on this show? She was sorely mistaken.

Outside the tent, Beatrice took a deep breath, forcibly suppressing her fury. Adjusting her expression for the cameras, she turned toward Evelyn Laurent's campsite.

By the shore, the four of them were busy processing freshly gathered vines.

Evelyn suddenly stood up, her fingers weaving swiftly as an intricate basket took shape. She weighted the bottom with stones and gently placed it in the shallows.

"What's this?" Julian asked curiously, moving closer.

"A fish trap." Without looking up, Evelyn began boiling seawater in a cast-iron pot.

Bianca Fairchild's eyes sparkled like stars. "Sister Evelyn, you're amazing!" She trailed after Evelyn like an eager puppy, admiration written all over her face.

Julian and Ethan Sullivan exchanged a glance, their expressions darkening simultaneously.

The vine in Ethan's hands snapped with a sharp crack. His jaw clenched as he watched Bianca cling to Evelyn's side.

If he'd known this would happen, he never would have agreed to switch groups.
###Chapter 357

Beatrice Quincy dragged her weakened steps toward Evelyn Laurent's campsite, just in time to see Julian Langley and Ethan Sullivan organizing vines with grim expressions. Evelyn was boiling water over a fire while Bianca Fairchild crouched nearby, feeding branches into the flames.

"Mr. Langley, what are you working on?"

Beatrice's voice was as faint as a mosquito's hum.

She moved slowly, her face pale as parchment, yet her eyes sparkled with curiosity.

Julian didn't bother looking up. "Can't you see for yourself?"

He kept working without granting her a single glance.

Beatrice clenched her fists, nails digging into her palms. She forced a smile. "Sorry to interrupt. I just wanted to check on Bianca."

Her gaze shifted to Bianca. "How's your arm injury? Do you need help changing the bandages?"

Bianca's body instantly stiffened.

Hearing Beatrice's voice triggered an involuntary tremble—a lingering effect from years of psychological control.

But feeling Evelyn's steady gaze, Bianca gradually relaxed. "Thanks for your concern. It's fine now."

Beatrice narrowed her eyes. "Seems you're quite happy here."

Her lips curved into a smile, but her eyes held daggers.

Before Bianca could respond, Evelyn suddenly spoke. "Anyone would be happy after escaping hell."

She set down the firewood, her gaze icy.

Beatrice's face darkened. "What do you mean by that, Evelyn?"

"Exactly what I said." Evelyn stood, towering over her. "Shall I tell the live audience what you've done to Bianca?"

Beatrice staggered back, shooting a panicked glance at the cameras. "We're sisters. What could I possibly do to her?"

Her eyes flashed a warning at Bianca.

The live chat exploded:

[OMG major tea!]
[Proof Beatrice bullied her sister!]
[BS! Beatrice is so sweet to Bianca!]
[Did you see Bianca tremble?]

Bianca silently moved behind Evelyn, meeting Beatrice's gaze directly for the first time.

Beatrice shook with rage.

Everything had gone wrong since arriving on this damned island. Now even this worthless girl dared defy her!

"Feeling guilty?" Evelyn advanced step by step.

Beatrice lifted her chin. "Why would I be?"
###Chapter 358

Beatrice Quincy glared at Evelyn Laurent with icy disdain, her voice dripping with authority. "Evelyn Laurent, stop trying to sow discord between us. Bianca and I grew up together. Our bond is unbreakable."

Evelyn's lips curled into a mocking smile, her gaze sharp as a blade. "Beatrice Quincy, do you even believe the nonsense you're spouting?"

"Beatrice!"

Xander Quincy's urgent shout cut through the tension between the two women.

He arrived breathless, sweat glistening on his forehead. Timothy Gold had summoned him in a panic, fearing Beatrice might cause an irreversible scene during the live broadcast.

Xander sensed something amiss between Beatrice and Bianca Fairchild—likely involving those unspeakable secrets of wealthy families.

Though he'd stood his ground against Beatrice earlier, now...

Sometimes retreat was the wiser choice.

Let Beatrice ruin her reputation elsewhere—just not during his show's live stream!

Xander grabbed Beatrice's wrist, his brow furrowed. "I told you to rest in the tent. Why are you out here?"

He knew the truth. Beatrice hadn't come for Bianca.

She'd used Bianca as an excuse to see Julian Langley.

Xander couldn't comprehend Beatrice's obsession with Julian, especially when the man clearly despised her.

Beatrice's eyes welled up instantly, her voice trembling. "Xander, I was just worried about Bianca, but..."

Her words dissolved into dramatic sobs, as if she'd suffered some grave injustice.

Xander's patience wore thin as he forced out a stiff consolation. "Enough, Beatrice. Stop crying."

Evelyn watched the performance with cold amusement. "How convincing."

Beatrice's tears halted momentarily before she wailed even louder.

Xander broke into a nervous sweat, desperately signaling Ethan Sullivan with his eyes.

For heaven's sake!

Make Evelyn shut up already!

Certain things shouldn't be discussed on camera...

His gaze shifted to Bianca, his expression unreadably complex.

But Bianca merely turned away, her indifference cutting deeper than any blade.

Xander stared at her, his chest constricting painfully.

Why...?

Why was she looking at him like a stranger?

A glint of cold fury flashed in Ethan's eyes. Just as Evelyn prepared another verbal strike, he gently tugged her sleeve.

Evelyn frowned and shot him an irritated glare.

Ethan raised his hand with puppy-dog eyes, his voice soft and wounded. "Evelyn... my hand hurts..."
###Chapter 359

Evelyn's gaze sharpened as it landed on Ethan's outstretched hand.

Her pupils contracted slightly.

"Your hand..."

Her fingertips lightly brushed the rash-covered skin. The contact burned.

Ethan withdrew his hand casually. "It's nothing. Probably just an allergic reaction."

His tone was calm, but his eyes shot a warning glare at Xander.

Xander's expression darkened instantly. He grabbed Beatrice's arm. "Enough. We're leaving."

"Brother!" Beatrice struggled against his grip, resentment flashing in her eyes.

Evelyn remained focused on examining Ethan's hand, missing the complicated look Xander gave her before departing.

His gaze lingered on Bianca for a brief moment before he turned away.

Inside the tent, Beatrice slammed the flap shut and ripped off her microphone.

"How dare they treat me like this!" Her voice trembled with rage, eyes red-rimmed.

She had always been the Quincy family's treasured jewel. Every whim catered to, every desire fulfilled.

Yet now, even the most obedient Bianca dared defy her.

"Enough." Xander's voice cut through her tantrum. "Stop provoking Evelyn."

"Me? Provoke her?" Beatrice's voice rose shrilly. "She's the one targeting me at every turn!"

Xander clamped a hand over her mouth. "Have you lost your mind?"

He hissed under his breath, "The Laurents back Evelyn. If this escalates, do you think the Quincy family's skeletons can withstand scrutiny?"

Beatrice paled.

"You think your dirty laundry is still secret?" Xander sneered. "That car accident last year alone—"

"Shut up!" Beatrice shoved him away violently. "That was an accident!"

Xander studied his sister with conflicted eyes.

Some truths, once exposed, could never be taken back.
###Chapter 360

Bianca Fairchild's origin was the Quincy family's most shameful secret.

She was never a true Quincy by blood.

The family had adopted her solely as a luck shield for Beatrice Quincy.

In the Quincy household, she wasn't even treated as human.

Xander Quincy had once fought for her.

That battle ended in devastating defeat.

His efforts only made Bianca avoid him like the plague.

"I can overlook Evelyn Laurent's interference," Beatrice bit her lip, eyes glinting with frost, "But how dare that Bianca waltz around like she owns the place? She's just a disposable luck charm!"

"Beatrice!"

Xander's voice cracked like a whip.

His knuckles whitened, jaw clenched tight. "Is this how the Quincys raised you? To spew such filth?"

Beatrice froze.

Her brother had never used that tone with her before.

What shocked her more was his fury being directed at Bianca's defense.

"Have you lost your mind?" Her voice turned shrill. "Don't tell me you're still obsessed with that trash! What spell did she cast on you?"

Xander silently thanked his foresight in dismissing the staff.

These words could ruin the Quincy name if overheard.

"Enough, Beatrice."

Exhaustion lined his features. "I warned you Julian Langley isn't interested. Why keep throwing yourself at the Langley family?"

"Only Julian deserves me!" She jutted her chin. "We're both Oscar winners. A perfect match!"

Her lips curled into a sneer. "Unlike some with trashy taste, pining after a worthless stand-in."

"Did our parents' lessons mean nothing?" Her whisper carried venom. "Imagine the scandal if they knew you still—"

"Beatrice!"

Xander's chest heaved, nails biting into his palms.

The sister he'd coddled since childhood now gazed at him with such contempt.

"Mother and Father were clear," she sang sweetly. "Anyone but that trash. Unless you want the Quincys to become a laughingstock?"

Each syllable pierced like an icicle.

He stood paralyzed, blood turning to sludge.

Suddenly Beatrice beamed, looping her arm through his. "But don't worry, dear brother. I'm your favorite, aren't I?"

Her sugary tone dripped poison. "You'd never truly fall for such filth... right?"
###Chapter 361

Beatrice's smile was particularly jarring.

Her radiant face bloomed with dazzling amusement, the corners of her eyes lifting like a rose in full bloom.

Yet Xander Quincy only felt a chill crawl down his spine.

Staring at his sister's flawless makeup, he momentarily saw the flickering tongue of a venomous serpent.

"Brother." Beatrice patted his shoulder lightly, the crushed diamonds on her nails glinting under the light. "You've never measured up to our eldest brother."

Her voice dripped with honeyed sweetness.

"Mom and Dad gave up on you long ago."

Xander's knuckles whitened from how tightly he clenched his fists.

The air inside the tent seemed to freeze solid.

Beatrice toyed with her nails leisurely, a cold smirk playing on her lips.

She knew this brother of hers too well.

Just as expected, Xander's Adam's apple bobbed several times before he spoke hoarsely, "Beatrice, stop provoking Evelyn Laurent."

"Why should I?" She snapped her head up.

"If she exposes all your dirty secrets..." His gaze darkened. "You won't be able to handle the consequences."

Beatrice scoffed.

Of course she knew how formidable Evelyn was.

But Julian Langley—

She would have him, no matter what.

"Fine." She replied dismissively, icy glints flashing in her eyes.

When Xander turned to leave, the temperature in the tent seemed to drop another few degrees.

Meanwhile, the scent of medicinal herbs lingered in Camp 3.

Evelyn focused on grinding herbs in a mortar, strands of hair swaying gently with each movement.

"Does it hurt?" She applied the salve to Ethan Sullivan's hand.

Ethan shook his head, his gaze tender enough to melt.

Julian suddenly squeezed between them, pouting as he extended both hands. "Evie, your third brother's hands hurt too."

He blinked up at her like a large, eager puppy.

Evelyn sighed in resignation.

The aroma of herbs mingled with campfire smoke, drifting lazily into the night.
###Chapter 362

The auction hall glittered under dazzling crystal chandeliers. Raina Qi's palm grew clammy around her bidding paddle.

"One hundred fifty million, first call!"

The auctioneer's voice echoed through the venue. Her gaze locked onto Viola Shi's direction, but the other woman didn't even glance her way.

Chen shoved her hand away, fury blazing in his eyes. "Idiot! You've been played!"

Raina's face turned ashen. Her nails dug crescent moons into her palms.

The call ended. She studied her flawless makeup in the mirror—then smashed her fist through the glass.

Shards sliced her fingertips. Blood dripped onto the marble countertop, each crimson drop mirroring her shattered dignity.
###Chapter 363

"Alright." Evelyn Laurent agreed briskly.

Bianca Fairchild always tempered her sharp edges around Beatrice Quincy, but her black belt in taekwondo was nothing to underestimate. Last time Beatrice caught her off guard was pure luck.

Ethan Sullivan's expression darkened instantly.

He never expected to guard against Julian Langley, only for Bianca to swoop in.

"Third brother, you and Ethan handle the vines." Evelyn tilted her chin at Julian. "Gather some branches later."

Julian grinned ear to ear.

For the first time, he found Bianca rather pleasing. He nodded eagerly. "Don't worry, I'll get it done."

The glee in his tone was unmistakable.

That Ethan kept finding excuses to hover around Evelyn had long grated on him.

First he broke off their engagement, now he wouldn't stop pestering her.

Trying to win his sister back?

Over his dead body.

Ethan saw right through Julian's thoughts.

Watching Evelyn's retreating figure, he suddenly called out, "Evelyn."

She paused and glanced back.

Ethan caught up in quick strides, his gaze intense. "I'm coming with you."

"Your hand—"

"It's fine now." He held it out. "I'm worried about you."

Evelyn arched a brow. "Nothing on this island can touch me."

Her tone carried careless arrogance.

But Ethan stubbornly grasped her hand. "Let me stay with you."

The warmth of his palm sent a tremor through her.

She met his unwavering stare, those eyes brimming with concern.

Behind them, Julian ground his teeth in frustration.

Ethan shot Bianca a warning glance, his eyes dark with unspoken threat.
###Chapter 364

Bianca's gaze flickered between the two of them before she lowered her lashes and took half a step back.

"My head still hurts," she murmured, fingers absently brushing the bandage at her temple. "You two go ahead."

Ethan immediately seized the opportunity. "I'll stay with you." His voice betrayed barely contained eagerness.

Evelyn finally remembered Bianca's injury. She bit her lip in regret. "Rest well, then."

The corners of Ethan's eyes crinkled with barely suppressed joy. He casually positioned himself beside Evelyn, close enough to catch the scent of sea breeze in her hair.

[OMG Ethan's gaze is lethal!]
[He literally glows when looking at Evelyn!]
[Bianca is such an angel TT]

The live chat exploded. Everyone could see the unmistakable adoration shining in Ethan's eyes.

"Tired of fish?" Ethan chuckled.

"Had it every day in the village." Her pout made her look like a petulant child.

Suddenly, sharp cries pierced the sky. A flock of seagulls circled above the waves.

Evelyn's eyes lit up. She swiftly bent to gather a handful of smooth stones, testing their weight in her palm.

Ethan held his breath.

With a flick of her wrist, the stones cut through the air. The startled gulls scattered, the last stone barely grazing a wingtip.

"Missed." She kicked the sand in frustration.

Watching her puffed cheeks, Ethan fought the urge to pinch them. "They'll come back," he soothed.

The sea wind tangled Evelyn's hair as she watched the retreating birds, oblivious to the tender devotion in the man's gaze beside her.
###Chapter 365

Evelyn shook her wrist, brushing off the disappointment of her failed bird hunt.

She crouched low, fingers gently parting the fallen leaves as her sharp eyes scanned for clues.

"Cottontail!" she whispered suddenly, pointing at the tracks and droppings on the ground.

Ethan moved closer and smirked. "Looks like we're having a feast tonight."

They moved silently through the trees like stalking leopards. Evelyn raised her hand in a sudden halt, gaze locking onto a gray blur ahead.

Her combat knife slid free with a practiced flick of her wrist.

Whoosh—

The blade flashed. The rabbit dropped instantly.

"Clean shot." Ethan nodded approvingly, though his brow twitched at the sight of blood.

Evelyn grabbed the rabbit and tossed it at him without looking. "Catch!"

He reflexively caught it but held it at arm's length, keeping his clothes pristine. His exasperated sigh went unnoticed as she was already sprinting after the next prey.

"Evelyn!" He broke into a run. "Slow down!"

Above them, a drone circled, capturing their rapid pursuit through the forest.

The production crew erupted into chaos. Timothy gripped his walkie-talkie. "Evelyn! Stop right now!"

The live chat exploded:

[That speed is insane! Is she an athlete?]
[CEO Ethan chasing after her is so hot!]

Victoria paled as she watched the tracking screen. "They're heading straight for the restricted zone!"

###Chapter 366

The gray rabbit kept thrashing wildly in her grip.

Evelyn Laurent swiftly grabbed its long ears. The creature immediately went limp.

She brushed grass stains off her clothes and stood up, a triumphant smile playing on her lips.

Ethan Sullivan rushed over, his face pale.

"Evelyn!" His voice was tight. "Don't do that again."

"Do what?" She tilted her head, still holding the rabbit.

Ethan seized her wrist.

His gaze locked onto the thin red scratch on her arm, his brows furrowing. "This is what you call unharmed?"

"This barely counts as a scratch." She shook her hand dismissively.

Ethan inhaled sharply.

"Then what would you consider an injury?"

Evelyn pointed at the lifeless rabbit in his hand. "That."

His eyes darkened instantly.

"If you ever got hurt like that," his voice dropped low, "I'd be a dead man."

"Why?" She blinked.

"Your parents. Your three brothers. My father." He enunciated each word. "They'd tear me apart limb by limb."

Not to mention his own heart would shatter.

"Oh." Realization dawned on her. "Relax, my reflexes are razor-sharp."

She turned to leave.

Ethan yanked her back.

"What now?" Evelyn shot him a wary glare.

Without a word, he pulled out a cotton swab and pressed it to her arm.

"Hold still." His voice was soft, his touch even softer.

She tried to pull away but found his grip unyielding.

His head was bent, long lashes casting shadows across his face.

The cotton swab dabbed gently at the wound, cleaning away dirt and blood.

"Evelyn Laurent." He suddenly looked up. "None of us want to see you hurt."

"Bleeding means you're injured," his voice roughened, "and it hurts us."

Evelyn abruptly asked, "What about menstrual cycles then?"

Ethan's hand jerked. The cotton swab fell to the ground.
###Chapter 367

Ethan Sullivan's ears turned crimson instantly. His gaze darted away in flustered panic.

His Adam's apple bobbed. His heart pounded like war drums.

How could this woman say such things without hesitation?

Evelyn Laurent tilted her head with an innocent expression. "Doesn't menstruation count as an injury?"

Ethan drew a sharp breath, his fingertips trembling slightly.

"Yes."

Memories surfaced of a girl fainting from cramps in the ER. A pang of tenderness twisted his chest.

So she endured this too.

Evelyn nodded thoughtfully and continued walking ahead.

An awkward tension lingered in the air.

"This rabbit..." Ethan cleared his throat, grasping for a subject change.

Evelyn crouched and lifted the creature by its scruff, examining it closely.

"It's from the production crew." Her tone was certain. "Wild cottontails aren't this easy to catch."

Ethan froze.

What life had his girl lived to recognize such details at a glance?

"Hold this." Evelyn suddenly shoved the squirming rabbit into his arms.

He fumbled to catch it. The limp body thudded to the ground.

The cottontail thrashed violently—

Its hind legs kicked out in a powerful jerk—

"!"

Warm liquid soaked through his camouflage pants.

Ethan stood rigid, his face turning ashen.

The acrid stench hit his nostrils. He nearly choked on the spot.

"Ethan?" Evelyn called from a short distance away.

Clenching his jaw, he gripped the damp rabbit, statue-still.

A conspicuous wet stain bloomed across his trousers.
###Chapter 368

Ethan Sullivan suddenly stopped walking, his face turning unusually grim.

"What's wrong?" Evelyn Laurent turned to look at him.

"The rabbit..." Ethan hesitated, his brows furrowed.

Evelyn was puzzled. "What about it?"

"It..." He took a deep breath. "Pee'd."

For a moment, Evelyn didn't react. "So what if it pee'd—"

Mid-sentence, realization struck. Her eyes widened as she stared at Ethan. "Don't tell me it got on you?"

Ethan gave a stiff nod, his expression ashen.

Evelyn rushed back and took the misbehaving bunny from him. She grabbed a handful of wild grass. "Here, wipe yourself first."

Ethan took the grass and hastily scrubbed at the damp spot on his trousers. His face was pinched, as if he might cry.

"Just bear with it." Evelyn deftly tied the rabbit with a rope. "Hold it like this. It won't pee on you again."

Ethan took the other end of the rope and finally relaxed.

Seeing the usually elegant and dignified CEO in such a disheveled state, Evelyn couldn't help but laugh.

She remembered the first time she'd met Ethan.

It had been raining that night, his luxury car stuck in the mud. Even then, he'd carried himself like a prince.

And now...

The scent of rabbit urine drifted on the breeze, making Evelyn laugh harder.

"Are you laughing at me, Evie?" Ethan suddenly asked, his voice small and wounded.

He kept his head down, mumbling, "Do you... dislike me now?"

The unexpected pout caught Evelyn off guard.

"No!" she denied quickly—only to meet Ethan's mischievous gaze.

He'd been faking it!

Evelyn stomped her foot in frustration. "Ethan Sullivan!"

"Here." He answered with a smile, his eyes full of affection.

Sunlight filtered through the leaves, dappling them both. Even the smell of rabbit pee didn't seem so bad anymore.
###Chapter 369

###Chapter 370

Ethan Sullivan had never ventured this deep into the island's interior.

###Chapter 371

"No half-measures for greatness." Feng Feiran’s smile turned icy. "If I can’t have it, no one will."

Beatrice Quincy yanked open her tent flap.

"What smells so good?" She inhaled deeply, stomach growling.

Nearby, Rachel Clemenson stumbled toward the aroma.

"Is that...roast meat?" She swallowed hard, steps quickening.

On the island, the tantalizing fragrance teased their senses.

Who could resist a bite of hot, juicy rabbit?
###Chapter 373

Evelyn Laurent and her three companions sat around the bonfire by the rocky shore.

The flames crackled as rabbit meat sizzled on skewers. The aroma of grilled seafood filled the air.

The other two groups watched hungrily, clutching their dry hardtack and sour wild berries.

Beatrice Quincy swallowed hard. "Where did you get rabbits?"

Rachel Clemenson stepped closer, her stomach growling. "Yeah, Evelyn. There are rabbits on this island?"

Without looking up, Evelyn pointed casually. "Over there."

Following her gesture, Rachel spotted three live rabbits tied beneath a tree near their camp.

"Evelyn!" Rachel's eyes lit up. "Can we trade for one?"

She crouched to untie the ropes without waiting for an answer. "We can exchange supplies. Name your price."

Crystal Rothschild stood nearby, her gaze fixed on the roasting meat. She tugged Hugo Rothschild's sleeve. "Let's go catch rabbits too."

The sea breeze carried the tantalizing scent of food as Rachel's fingers brushed the knot.

Evelyn suddenly lifted her gaze, eyes sharp as daggers. "Who said you could touch that?"

Rachel froze mid-motion, her smile stiffening.

"Hungry?" Evelyn turned the skewers with deliberate slowness. "Go hunt your own."

The firelight flickered across her face as a cold smirk curved her lips.
###Chapter 374

Evelyn Laurent's eyes turned icy as the aroma of roasted rabbit wafted from her hands.

"No trade."

Her two-word refusal cut through the air like a blade.

Rachel Clemenson's outstretched hand froze midair, surprise flashing across her face. "Why? We're offering double the supplies."

She bit her lip, voice trembling. "We're all contestants on the same show..."

"Competitors," Evelyn interrupted with a mocking smirk. "The director said we survive by our own skills."

Rachel paled.

Leo Clemenson stepped forward. "Evelyn Laurent! You're being selfish!"

He shielded his sister, outrage burning in his eyes. "It's just a damn rabbit."

Evelyn rose slowly, handing the roasting stick to Ethan Sullivan.

"Get out of my camp."

Her quiet command made the air itself seem to solidify.

Rachel's eyes welled up as she tugged her brother back. "Forget it, Leo..."

Crystal Rothschild hurried to mediate. "We can hunt our own food."

Hugo Rothschild remained silent.

He leaned against a tree trunk, wolf-like eyes locked on Evelyn with predatory intensity.

Ethan moved between them, his protective stance unmistakable.

"Enough." His warning glare at Hugo preceded a gentle touch on Evelyn's shoulder. "Don't waste anger on irrelevancies."

Evelyn sat back down, firelight carving sharp shadows across her stoic profile.

The Clemenson siblings retreated in defeat.

Hugo chuckled low, his interest visibly deepening.

This dangerous woman...

Grew more fascinating by the minute.
###Chapter 375

Hugo Rothschild's gaze was as sharp as a blade, clashing with Ethan Sullivan's across the distance.

Sparks seemed to fly in the air.

Neither man was willing to back down.

Julian Langley immediately sensed the tension, his icy glare fixed on Hugo. "How dare you kidnap my Evelyn?"

His voice dripped with frost.

"If you want rabbit meat, catch it yourself." Julian shielded Evelyn Laurent with his body. "Don't expect her to serve you."

Rachel Clemenson stood nearby, her nails digging into her palms.

Why?

Why did Evelyn get protection from two men?

She stared at Evelyn's delicate face, resentment flashing in her eyes.

That bitch must have seduced Ethan and Julian with her looks.

What infuriated her even more was that Hugo's attention remained fixed on Evelyn.

This man, always cold and distant, showed interest only in her.

"Let's go," Rachel forced out through gritted teeth, her voice laced with feigned hurt. "We're clearly not welcome here."

She deliberately let out a bitter laugh. "We don't belong in their world."

Before leaving, Hugo cast one last lingering look at Evelyn.

But she didn’t even glance his way.

Beatrice Quincy eyed the golden-brown rabbit meat roasting over the fire, swallowing hard.

"Brother," she tugged at Xander Quincy's sleeve. "I want some."

When Xander frowned, she added, "Can you trade with them?"

"No." His refusal was firm. "We’ll catch our own."

Liam Croix chimed in, "We set up traps. Should get something soon."

"Self-reliance is best," Lucas Croix agreed.

Beatrice bit her lip in frustration but had no choice but to follow them away.

In the firelight, Evelyn’s profile looked especially soft.

Ethan and Julian both turned to her at the same time, their gazes warm.
###Chapter 376

Silence finally returned after the two groups walked away.

Evelyn Laurent focused on turning the rabbit meat over the fire, brushing it with a secret sauce. The rich aroma filled the air.

Julian Langley stared hungrily at the roasting rabbit, his Adam's apple bobbing.

"Patience," Evelyn chuckled, deftly tearing off a leg.

She handed the first foreleg to Julian, the second to Ethan Sullivan. She and Bianca Fairchild each took a hind leg.

The four dug in eagerly.

The rabbit was crispy outside and tender inside, its juices bursting between their teeth. Julian devoured his entire foreleg in just a few bites.

Evelyn used her combat knife to divide the remaining meat.

Soon, the rabbit was completely gone, but they still craved more. After finishing some grilled fish and shrimp, they leaned back against the tree, satisfied.

The shade enveloped Evelyn like an umbrella.

She stretched out, finding a comfortable position to lie down. Bianca settled beside her while Julian took the other side.

Ethan, sitting beyond Julian, gazed at Evelyn with a heavy expression.

If not for the change in groupings, he would have been the one by her side.

"I'm going to nap," Evelyn yawned, her eyelids drooping.

The morning's exertion had drained her, and drowsiness now took over.

Ethan frowned. "Not going back to the tent?"

"Too stuffy," she waved him off.

The midday island sun was scorching, turning the tent into a sauna. Evelyn hated the heat, preferring the cool shade beneath the tree.

Silently, Ethan removed his jacket and spread it beneath her. "Don't catch a chill."

She didn't refuse, resting her head on his tailored suit as she drifted off. Julian, too, succumbed to sleep.

Bianca exchanged a knowing glance with Ethan.

"I'll sleep in the tent," she whispered. "My wound shouldn't be exposed to the wind."

With that, she left.

Ethan carefully moved closer to Evelyn.

He studied her sleeping face. Compared to when they first met, her cheeks had filled out, no longer gaunt from malnutrition.

Now, her skin glowed with health under the dappled sunlight.

A tender smile touched Ethan's eyes.

Sunlight filtered through the leaves, casting golden flecks on her lashes. Unable to resist, he reached out and gently brushed away a stray lock of hair from her forehead.
###Chapter 377

Evelyn Laurent and Julian Langley slept soundly beneath the shade of the trees.

Ethan Sullivan leaned against the trunk beside Evelyn, his gaze tender as he watched her. He held a broad palm leaf in his hand, gently fanning it to send cool breezes her way.

The light wind brushed past, easing the furrow between Evelyn's brows from the heat. Ethan's eyes softened with concern as he noticed the fine beads of sweat on her forehead.

He recalled the investigative files—the image of a young girl studying late into the night in a shabby rented room. Despite the harsh conditions, she had maintained an astonishing passion for learning. That same resilience now allowed her to sleep peacefully on the hard ground.

As the sea breeze picked up, Ethan set the palm leaf aside and closed his eyes to rest.

The cameraman adjusted his equipment before taking a short break himself. Filming Evelyn was physically demanding—she moved with the agility of a sprite, often leaving him breathless as he chased after her.

When Evelyn awoke, the sunlight had lost its scorching intensity. She stretched and sat up, noticing that the figure beside her had changed from Bianca Fairchild to Ethan.

Sensing her movement, Ethan slowly opened his eyes. In that first moment of eye contact, his gaze was still hazy with sleep—but the instant he recognized her, warmth flooded his expression. "Sleep well?" he murmured, keeping his voice low.

Evelyn turned her face away slightly. "Not bad," she replied softly.

Her eyes caught on the palm leaf resting near Ethan's hand, and something stirred in her chest. "Were you fanning me?"

Ethan smiled and nodded. That simple gesture sent an unfamiliar ripple through her heart.

"Sis, you're awake!" Julian rubbed his eyes as he sat up, wincing as he massaged his lower back. "This ground is brutal. My back's killing me."

He turned to Evelyn with concern. "You okay?"

She shook her head. Sleeping outdoors was nothing new to her.

Then she glanced at Ethan. "What about you? Are you uncomfortable?"

The corner of Ethan's mouth curved up. Sunlight filtered through the leaves, casting dappled shadows across his striking features—his smile held an inexplicable allure.
###Chapter 378

Sunlight streamed through the floor-to-ceiling windows into the living room. Evelyn Laurent was organizing the medical kit with her head bowed.

Ethan Sullivan leaned against the sofa, his long fingers pressing gently against his lower back.

"What's wrong?" Evelyn looked up just in time to catch his slight frown.

Ethan lifted his gaze, warmth shimmering in his eyes. "Just a little sore."

His voice was soft, but it sent a shiver through Evelyn's fingertips.

"Do you want—" Before she could finish, Julian Langley stormed over.

"Ethan Sullivan!" Julian gritted his teeth. "Stop pretending to be pitiful!"

Ethan lowered his lashes, silently massaging his back.

Evelyn sighed and patted the sofa. "Third Brother, come here."

Julian eyed her suspiciously before sitting down. The next second, a pair of delicate hands settled on his shoulders.

"Hiss—" He sucked in a sharp breath.

Evelyn's fingers pressed precisely into his pressure points with just the right amount of force.

"Feel better?" she asked softly.

Julian half-closed his eyes like a contented cat. "You're amazing, Evie!"

He shot Ethan a smug look, only to find the man staring intently at Evelyn's profile.

The live chat exploded:

[Julian's asking for a beating!]
[Ethan's gaze is lethal!]
[Evie's technique is so professional!]

When the massage ended, Julian rolled his shoulders. "When did you learn this, Evie?"

"From Grandpa Liu back in the village." Evelyn's eyes softened slightly.

She suddenly remembered the elders of White Stone Village and made a mental note to visit soon.

"Your turn." She turned to Ethan.

Surprise flickered in Ethan's eyes before he obediently took his seat.

The moment Evelyn's hands touched his shoulders, Julian's eyes widened.

"Wait—Evie, you—"

Ethan's lips curved slightly. Out of the camera's view, his fingers brushed lightly against Evelyn's wrist.
###Chapter 379

Julian Langley glared at Ethan Sullivan, his eyes burning with fury.

Evelyn Laurent's slender fingers rested lightly on Ethan's shoulders, massaging with practiced ease.

Ethan's eyes were half-closed, a faint smile playing on his lips.

"Evelyn!" Julian shot to his feet. "Let me do it!"

He stormed over in three strides, reaching to pull Evelyn away.

She didn't budge. "Third Brother, this requires technique."

"I'm a fast learner!" Julian retorted stubbornly.

Ethan opened his eyes, amusement dancing in his gaze. "The Oscar-winning actor should rest."

A vein throbbed at Julian's temple.

He stared daggers at Ethan's contented expression, itching to yank him from the chair.

"Third Brother," Evelyn sighed. "Your pressure is too strong."

Julian looked thunderstruck.

Him? An acclaimed actor, rejected by his own sister for being too rough?

Ethan chuckled. "Evelyn's technique is indeed professional."

Her fingertips glided over his shoulders with perfect precision.

Ethan could feel the warmth of her touch, the faint floral scent clinging to her.

He remembered their first meeting—when she'd shattered a sandbag with one punch.

That explosive strength now controlled with such delicate mastery.

"Done." Evelyn withdrew her hands.

Ethan rolled his shoulders. "Much better."

He stood and circled behind her. "My turn."

Julian bristled instantly. "Don't you dare!"

He seized Ethan's collar, murder in his eyes.

"Third Brother." Evelyn caught Julian's wrist. "It's just a massage."

She sat down and nodded to Ethan. "Your turn."

Ethan's long fingers settled on her shoulders, impossibly gentle.

Julian stood rigid, knuckles cracking from clenched fists.

His glare fixed on Ethan's hands, already calculating how many extra gym sessions he'd need.

Live stream comments exploded:

[Julian's face is killing me!]

[Ethan's technique looks pro!]

[Anyone else see Julian crushing the armrest?]
###Chapter 380

Julian Langley's glare could have flayed Ethan Sullivan alive, as if watching a thief steal his most prized possession.

[LMAO, little sister made it crystal clear she's done with the Oscar winner]

[Today's emotional damage to Julian Langley is worse than 100 consecutive NG takes]

Absolutely true.

On the show's premiere day, Julian suffered a series of brutal blows.

Regret gnawed at him.

He'd brought Evelyn to this island reality show hoping she'd relax—and more importantly, stay far away from that punk Ethan.

Yet the bastard had followed them like a haunting spirit.

Now separating them seemed impossible.

He'd made a terrible mistake.

If he'd known this would happen, he'd never have taken this gig.

No—he should've kept the filming location top secret, ensuring Ethan never caught wind of it.

Or stationed bodyguards around Evelyn 24/7!

The audacity of this guy!

Julian ground his teeth watching Ethan massage Evelyn's shoulders with professional precision.

He nearly cracked a molar.

When the massage ended, Evelyn rotated her neck approvingly. "Not bad."

Ethan's martial arts training gave him exceptional muscle control. His fingers worked with perfect pressure.

"At your service anytime," he smiled.

Evelyn moved to inspect the partially dried vines—perfect for weaving.

She started with rabbit cages. Fresh kills tasted best.

Her fingers flew. The vines became living extensions of her hands, transforming into intricate cages with astonishing speed.

Julian's eyes burned. "Evie...you used to do this often?" His voice cracked with心疼.

"Mm. Two bucks per basket."

She'd learned the craft from Granny Sun in the countryside.

Bamboo would've been faster, but vines worked.

After finishing the cages, she quickly taught the three men basic mat-weaving techniques before grabbing her combat knife.

Ethan stood to follow.

She waved him off.

Fidgeting, he resumed weaving while stealing glances toward the trees.

The vines creaked under his grip.

What was she doing?

Was she safe?

Every fiber of him screamed to chase after her.
###Chapter 381

Evelyn Laurent moved through the trees, her combat knife in hand.

Sunlight filtered through the leaves, casting dappled shadows across her body.

The cameraman followed closely behind, his lens trained on her every move.

She paused, scanning the surrounding trees.

Resources were scarce on the island. She had to use what was available to build a shelter.

A wooden cabin was the best option.

Tents were too stuffy—she hated that suffocating feeling.

Evelyn selected several trees of the right thickness.

She weighed the knife in her hand, then swung it through the air.

The blade sliced through the wind with a sharp whistle.

"Step back," she said without turning.

The cameraman instinctively retreated.

Evelyn bent her knees slightly and gripped the knife with both hands.

A flash of steel.

Crack!

The trunk split cleanly in half.

The cameraman’s hand jerked.

The live chat exploded.

[What the hell?!]
[That technique is insane!]
[She cut down a tree with a knife? In one strike?!]

The cut was smooth, as if made by machinery.

Without hesitation, Evelyn turned to the next tree.

Another swing.

Three more trees fell in quick succession.

She tied the four trunks together and dragged them back with a rope.

The five-meter logs felt weightless in her grasp.

The cameraman had to jog to keep up.

[Is she even human?]
###Chapter 382

[That strength is unreal!]

Rachel Clemenson heard the commotion and rushed over just in time to see it.

Her eyes widened, lips trembling.

"That’s impossible..."

Evelyn walked past her, dragging the lumber without breaking stride.

Rachel’s gaze locked onto the perfectly clean cuts.

Her face drained of color.
Sunlight dappled through the leaves onto the center of the camp.

All eyes froze when Evelyn Laurent returned dragging four thick tree trunks.

Rachel Clemenson's nails dug deep into her palms.

She stared at the trees, lips twisting into a sneer. "The production crew must be working overtime."

Leo Clemenson immediately caught her drift. "Sis, connections are everything these days. Regular folks like us should know our place."

Crystal Rothschild frowned. "Stop spreading rumors. The cameras are rolling."

"So what?" Rachel raised her voice. "With today's editing technology, who knows what'll end up on screen?"

She deliberately glanced toward the cameras, already imagining the trending hashtags.

Hugo Rothschild's gaze turned glacial.

"Brains are useful things." His thin lips barely moved. "Pity you lack them."

Rachel's face stiffened. "Hugo—"

"Don't call me that." His voice cut like ice. "It disgusts me."

Leo jumped up. "What's that supposed to mean?"

"Exactly what I said." Hugo's smile was arctic. "The air turns foul around you."

He turned to pull Crystal away. "We're switching teams."

"You can't!" Rachel shrieked. "The director won't allow it!"

Hugo didn't look back. "Then we quit."

His quiet words silenced the entire camp.

Rachel's face drained of color.

She never expected Hugo to go this far.

Evelyn seemed to notice the commotion and glanced their way.

Rachel immediately straightened, projecting her voice. "Don't get cocky! The audience sees everything!"

Hugo paused mid-step.

He turned, eyes colder than glacial ice. "One more word against her..."

The unspoken threat hung heavy in the air.

Rachel involuntarily stepped back.

Only when Hugo was out of earshot did she regain her composure, trembling with rage.

"Sis..." Leo began hesitantly.

"Shut up!" Rachel hissed through clenched teeth. "Let's see how long she can keep up this act!"

Her venomous gaze locked onto Evelyn's retreating figure, eyes burning with malice.
###Chapter 383

Hugo Rothschild grabbed Crystal Rothschild's wrist and strode away without looking back.

Rachel Clemenson stood frozen in place, her eyes instantly welling up with tears.

Large teardrops rolled down her cheeks. "They... they're so cruel..."

She covered her face and sobbed.

Leo Clemenson hurried over and wrapped an arm around his sister's shoulders. "Don't pay attention to trash like that!"

Crystal Rothschild was a rising starlet.

Who did Hugo Rothschild think he was?

A nobody daring to act so arrogantly?

Just wait until they got back—her fans would teach him a lesson.

A flash of malice flickered in Leo's eyes.

Neither of them noticed the live stream chat exploding with outrage.

[Is Rachel out of her mind? I used to think she was genuine, but now she’s just pathetic!]

[Disgusting! She’s been targeting Evelyn Laurent since the first episode!]

[What did Evelyn ever do to her? Can’t handle losing so she accuses others of cheating?]

[Get her off the show! I can’t stand her!]

The barrage of hate flooded the screen.

Evelyn Laurent stood nearby, having heard every word of their exchange.

Her gaze turned icy as she hoisted four massive trees and strode toward the Clemenson siblings.

"Did I hear something about cheating?"

Her cold voice made Rachel flinch.

Looking up, Rachel saw Evelyn standing before her, effortlessly holding four trees with one hand, her eyes sharp as blades.

Both siblings instinctively took a step back.

Leo forced a sneer. "Stop pretending. You think waving around props makes you impressive?"

Without a word, Evelyn released her grip.

BOOM—

The four trees slammed into the ground, kicking up a cloud of dust.

The deep drag marks left behind proved they were real.

"Pick them up," Evelyn said coolly.

Leo scoffed. "They’re just props. Anyone could lift them."

He moved to step forward, but Rachel yanked him back.

She smirked at Evelyn. "Cut the act. Do you really want us to expose you right here?"

"Idiots." Evelyn’s lips curled in disdain.

Rachel’s face flushed red with anger. She grabbed one of the ropes and yanked with all her strength.

The trees didn’t budge.

Her face drained of color.

These... were real?
###Chapter 384

Rachel's palms were slick with cold sweat.

Her fingers trembled uncontrollably.

She stared at the scattered equipment parts on the ground, her throat tight.

"I..." Her lips parted, but no sound came out.

Leo yanked her arm. "Rachel, we need to go!"

They fled like rabbits chased by hunters, their footsteps frantic.

Evelyn's silhouette dragging four trees cast a harsh shadow under the sunlight.

"How could she..." Leo's voice caught in his throat.

Rachel dug her nails deep into her palms.

The director's furious roar echoed from afar. "Rachel! Have you lost your mind?"

The cameraman cradled the broken camera, his eyes red-rimmed. "My livelihood..."

Rachel's lips turned bloodless.

She realized her slap might have destroyed more than just the camera.

"It's over..." she murmured.

Leo pulled out his phone, fingers flying across the screen. "I'm calling the PR team now."

The live chat exploded.

[Is Rachel insane?]
[That's intentional destruction of production property!]
[First accusing Evelyn of cheating, now smashing cameras. These siblings are something else.]

Evelyn dropped the trees with a thud, kicking up dust.

She turned just in time to see Rachel's fleeing figure.

"Tch." Her lips curled in disdain.

The director stormed over. "Evelyn, about what just—"

"Not my problem," she cut him off. "Someone's reaping what they sowed."

The director hesitated, then sighed.

Rachel's hysterical scream pierced the air. "It was an accident! Stop filming!"

Evelyn brushed wood chips from her hands, her gaze icy.

This farce was only beginning.
###Chapter 385

The confrontation between Rachel and Leo Clemenson with Evelyn Laurent was captured live on camera.

The danmu exploded instantly.

[Are the Clemenson siblings insane? Do they think viewers are stupid?]

[LOL! Accusing someone of cheating when they can't even scrape bark off trees!]

The livestream's popularity skyrocketed.

Rachel's fan club president publicly announced withdrawing support.

[Three years of fandom—wasted. I'm done.]

[Assaulting cameramen? Career suicide.]

[Someone check these siblings for mental instability.]

Evelyn remained oblivious.

She dragged four massive trees single-handedly through the forest like it was nothing.

At the campsite, Ethan Sullivan was weaving vines when rustling sounds startled him.

His pupils dilated as Evelyn emerged dragging the timber.

"Evelyn!"

Ethan sprinted forward.

The bundled trees left deep furrows in the dirt.

"Why didn't you call me?" His voice tightened.

Evelyn tilted her head. "Could you have carried them?"

Ethan's Adam's apple bobbed.

Gripping the ropes, his muscles strained against the sunlight.

The trees lifted inch by inch.

Ten steps.

Twenty.

Beads of sweat formed on his forehead.

"Not bad." Evelyn whistled.

Ethan lowered the load with a wry smile.

Now he understood the gap between them firsthand.

"Let me try!" Julian Langley bounded over.

Seeing Ethan's raw palms and Evelyn's effortless poise, the teenager's mouth twitched.

"Sis, are you actually a robot?"

Danmu erupted again.

Meanwhile, Rachel's agency convened an emergency meeting.

"Issue an apology statement. NOW."
###Chapter 386

Julian Langley rushed forward eagerly and grabbed the rope.

"Hey—"

With a sudden burst of strength, his face flushed crimson.

The rope pulled taut, but the four trees didn't budge an inch.

Gritting his teeth, veins bulging on his forehead, he barely managed to drag them a short distance.

"Huff..." Julian released the rope, bracing his hands on his knees as he panted. "Evelyn, you..."

His gaze lifted to Evelyn Laurent, filled with astonishment.

Where did this girl get such inhuman strength?

Evelyn pressed her lips together in a faint smile.

She had always been unusually strong since childhood.

Add to that three years of training under that mysterious Tai Chi master in the park.

The old man often called her a once-in-a-century martial arts prodigy.

Turns out he wasn't lying.

Bianca Fairchild stood nearby, eyes wide as saucers.

The three young men exchanged glances before silently picking up the rope again.

No way were they letting a girl do such heavy labor.

Back at the campsite, Julian wiped his sweat. "Evelyn, what do you need these logs for?"

"Building a house, of course." She said it like it was the most obvious thing in the world.

Grabbing an axe, she swung it down effortlessly.

The thick tree trunks split into perfectly even planks under her hands, as if she were slicing tofu.

Four main beams were ready in no time.

The production crew held their breath.

Evelyn planted her feet firmly and wrapped her arms around a wooden pillar.

"Ha!"

With a sharp cry, the pillar sank half its length into the ground.

Silence fell over the entire site.

Julian and Ethan Sullivan swallowed hard in unison.

But Bianca clapped excitedly. "Evelyn, you're amazing!"

The live chat exploded:

[What did I just witness?!]

[Driving pillars barehanded? Is this even possible?]

[Is Evelyn some hidden martial arts master?]

[That arm strength—I bow down.]

[Someone check if the ground's made of tofu.]

Unfazed, Evelyn repeated the process.

Three more pillars stood firmly rooted.
